ATPU police forces violently apprehend two al Shabaab suspects in 20/04. They were detained without charge and appeared in court twice, but then were taken to an undisclosed location and remain missing.
Police accused of abusing civilians during security crackdown. Allegations that officers have harassed, beaten and looted villagers property
Residents stage sit-in to protest court order to evict them
Boda boda operators block roads to protest poor road conditions

The mutilated and tortured body of a terror suspect (Khalif Mwangi) is discovered in a drainage ditch on 20/05. Police are believed to be responsible. The date of death is not known, though a witness in the mortuary believed it had occurred only a few days prior.
Beach operators protest alleged harassment by Kenya Wildlife Service Wardens
Garre militia attacks Degodia herdsman

Originally thought of as a shootout with al Shabaab, Human Right Watch has learned several witnesses have claimed officers from the counterterrorism unit and the General Service Unit had surrounded their apartment block in Nairobi's Githurai Kimbo estate in the evening of May 18, 2013, then stormed their apartment and shot [two al Shabaab suspects-Hassan Omondi Owiti and Shekha Wanjiru] dead without armed resistance.
Armed group kills police officer from rival ethnic group
Garre militia attacks Degodia herdsman

Police kill two terror suspects in shoot-out.
Family of British man who died in police custody stage demonstration on anniversary of his death
Al Shabaab militants attack village and hijack vehicles

Armed cattle raiders attack woman during invasion
Truck drivers block roads at weighbridge to protest perceived unfair treatment
""One security guard was killed when a group of men armed with blades forced entry to the office of an NGO, which they then robbed.""
Armed group kills civilians in Garissa
Armed group ambushes guards at Ifo market, kills 3
Degodia attack Garre civilians near Mandera

Sawmillers camp at governors office to protest against logging ban
Unidentified armed group kills two, one of whom was a security guard. Motive unknown.

Suspected al Shabaab gunmen kill two Kenyans who were carrying supplies near the border with Somalia
Oil refinery workers protest at threatened closure of the facility
Garre militia attacks Degodia herdsman
Police officer shoots and kills a university student during and argument
Property destruction: Unidentified armed group attacks two communication masts in refugee camp; no civilians were injured in the attack, though equipment and walls were destroyed
Al Shabaab-linked suspects throw grenade, injuring several civilians
Attackers suspected to be linked to Al Shabaab throw grenade into church compound, injuring civilians
Armed group attacks and kills civilians in ambush
Demonstrations outside parliament to protest lawmakers plans to raise their salaries
Police and al Shabaab suspect engage in gun battle; terror suspect killed
Boda boda operators protest perceived police harassment
Police arrest and torture terrorism suspect. The man claims to be innocent and was released without charge
Unidentified group attacks Somali MPs meeting in Nairobi

Ibrahim Ramadhan Mwasi (alias Ruta), was shot dead on the evening of June 17, 2013, by a lone gunman. The identity of the gunman has not been established but witnesses believe ATPU (police) officers were responsible. Ruta was among six suspects in a grenade attack on the Machakos bus station in Nairobi on March 10, 2012.
Gunmen attack village and kill civilians
Police engage in shoot-out with Al Shabaab suspect; the suspect was killed
Police engage in shoot-out with Al Shabaab suspect; the suspect was killed
Ethnic clash in refugee camp leaves 4 dead
Police battle mechanics and artisans who were rioting after being blocked from their work area
Gunmen kill police reservist
Police shoot protester while trying to break up a demonstration
Members of Albino Society of Kenya protest discrimination
Government workers stage protest over wages
Kenyan police intercept Al Shabaab truck carrying explosives in northeastern Kenya
Clan fighting leaves 4 dead
Clan fighting leaves 5 dead
Attack on Degodia village by Garre militia
Attack on Degodia village by Garre militia
Grenade attack by Garre militia leaves 16 dead
Degodia attack Garre civilians in Wajir
Police fight armed clans who were preparing to attack local villages; one attacker killed
Garre militia attacks Murle village
Students riot and block road; police use tear gas to disperse rioters
Students riot and block road; police use tear gas to disperse rioters
Attack on Degodia village by Garre militia
Protesters march from Freedom Corner, Uhuru Park to the front gate of the parliament building against a proposed plan to give MPs a pay raise.
Lobby groups staged protests in Uhuru to oppose the Value Added Tax Bill, which was being brought before the National Assembly at the time of the demonstration.

40 people, including two government officials, were held hostage by gunmen suspected to be al Shabaab militia from Somalia in Hullugho border town. The gunmen apprehended the group while the were travelling from Masalani.

A group of workers strike, protest for a salary increase near Mombasa city hall. The over 2,000 workers marched in the streets carrying a coffin, placards and chanting anti-Hassan Joho (Mombasa Governor) slogans. They marched along Moi, Digo and Nkrumah Roads.

At fifteen are dead after a group of hired thugs attack a small village during the overnight hours. Ten of those killed were from three families and included three children while the other two victims were a school boy and a man who bumped into the attackers as they left the village. Authorities believe the attackers were hired by a rival family seeking land.
Second day of workers protests at Mombasa city hall. Some members of the group attacked a county official outside the building.
Highway construction workers gathered at their companies offices near Turbo to protest over a delay in pay.
A group of butchers blocked the Thika-Garissa highway outside of Thika in protest of increased slaughter prices.
Residents of Wajir gather to protest the delay of a sewer building project.

A group of youths blocked a section of Juja Road to protest the death of the woman who was reportedly killed by a stray bullet that was fired by police during a drug raid. There were reports of protestor confrontations with police, who eventually used tear gas to disperse the crowd.

Residents held a peaceful demonstration over poor services by the Kiambere Mwingi Water and Sanitation Company in Mwingi. The residents led walked from Mwingi downtown towards Kimwasco offices and said they were tired of mistreatment by employees in kiosks.
Ukasi residents protest a recent spat of killings in their area. The nature of the violence is not clear. The group gathered along Garissa-Mwingi road.
""One security guard for an NGO was shot when he interrupted what was likely an attempted armed robbery of an NGO compound in Dadaab.""

A group of Boda Boda Riders (motorcycle group) gather to protest the killing of two of their colleagues by gangsters. The group called on the police to investigate the case. Police dispersed the group with teargas and made over 120 arrests.
Nigerians living in Nairobi gather at the High Commission to protest police harassment. The group believed authorities stereotyped them as miscreants and drug dealers.
Police shoot and kill a Nakuru Matatu driver for an unarticulated reason.
A group of 500 Nakuru Matatu drivers protest a killing of one of their compatriots by police earlier in the week. Police fired tear gas to disperse the group.
A man has been lynched by a mob in Mariakani, Mombasa, after he was suspected to be behind a cartel that has been harassing and stealing motorbikes from boda boda operators.
Prison warders at Manyani Maximum Prisons blocked the Nairobi-Mombasa highway for several hours to protest the killing of their colleague who was run over by a lorry.
For the second time in less than a week, Nigerians living in Kenya protest alleged police harassment.

Makueni boda boda operators demonstrated against the IEBCs (Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission) move to hire non-local transporters to ferry polling materials in preparation a Senatorial by-election.

Maasai homeowners began a violent protest against a forced government eviction of their homes. The evictees and their supporters threw stones and lifted clubs against visiting Rift Valley Provincial Commissioner Osman Warfa and his security team, accusing them of standing by as the families were forced from their residences illegally. Windscreens of some of the officials vehicles were shattered. The reason for the eviction is not clear.
A vigilante mob lynches and kills an alleged murderer after he was cornered on allegations of killing a teacher.
Wheat farmers of Narok County gathered at the offices of National Cereal and Produce Board in Nairobi to protest the move by two millers to reduce the purchasing price of the produce.
Police kill seven suspected kidnappers during a raid on their den.
Over 60 heavily armed Pokot bandits attacked residents of Nachola village in Baragoi, injured an eight-year-old boy and stole a large number of cattle.
Six people are shot and wounded by a ""terror gang"" near Nairobi estate in Kisauni District. Linked to the attacks, two petrol bombs were also recovered metres away from the church, in Mlaleo area.
Protesting students of Mwandango High School block teachers from entering campus in an effort to stop them from administering an examination.
Nine students are arrested after they burned the school dormitory in protest of an exam.
Boda boda operators in Rongo town protest against the increase of operating charges from Sh80 to Sh100.
At least four fishermen are dead in Lake Turkana after suspected Merille militia from neighbouring Ethiopia attacked them.

A group of people living with disabilities protested at Ol Kalou town in Nyandarua county at the weekend. The group was objecting to the nomination of their representatives to the county assembly. The protesters said it is wrong for able-bodied people to take up seats reserved for people living with disabilities. The nominees are set to be sworn in next week.
Residents of Tangisir village in Meibeki/Karuna ward lynched a herdsman after he admitted to defiling and killing a seven-year-old nursery school girl.

One person has been gunned and three others injured in Moyale following a confrontation between rioting locals and security personnel in the area. The injured include two civilians and one officer attached to the Moyale police station. During the commotion residents also set fire to offices belonging to the Assistant County Commissioner and looted other locations. The rioters demanded the national government transfer top administration and security personnel in Moyale sub-county. Military personnel was sent to the town following the riot to quell the demonstrators.
Angry Meru residents who were demonstrating against insecurity beat up and nearly lynched a pickpocket who was caught trying to steal from one of the protestors.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Police shoot and kill a Matatu driver when he refused to pay a bribe.
Five ""thugs"" are lynched by local vigilante mobs.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
Seven Kenyan fishermen operating in Lake Turkana have been killed by Murle militiamen from Ethiopia. Another 20 fishermen are missing.

More than 2000 residents living near the Malindi airport yesterday held a demonstration protesting against a plan to expand the runway. The residents opposed the move and asked the authorities to relocate the airport to Langobaya claiming it will cause huge losses to over 25,000 households residing within the stipulated area.
Residents of Kathita village in Embu beat up and burnt to death a suspected criminal.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
A police officer shoots and injured a matatu operator over the payment of a bribe. Other nearby matatu operators attacked the police officer in revenge.

Hundreds of matatu operators held demonstrations in the streets of Eldoret town following the shooting of a tout by a police officer after they allegedly differed on a Sh100 bribe. Police dispersed the crowd with rubber bullets.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.
A impromptu mob lynches a suspected thief.
Students of MAASAI Mara University protest for six days over the removal of the acting Vice-Chancellor Prof David Serem.

Residents of Kanyaltin in West Pokot county protest over illegal logging at Kapkanyar forest by rogue traders. Led by Pokot South MP David Kosing, the residents asked the government to stop the cutting of trees that has now created tension in the area.
Striking Mombasa county workers took to the streets over for payment of their five-month salary arrears.
A suspected thief has been killed by a mob in Baba Dogo area in Nairobi. Eyewitnesses say, the man was part of a gang suspected to have carried out an early morning robbery.
An ethnic clash over land caused one death along the Trans Mara West and Kuria East district border.
More than 3,000 families have fled their homes at the Kenya-Ethiopia border following the killing of ten fisherman by unknown Ethiopia militia.

About 20-30 al Shabaab fighters attacked Galmagala police post in Fafi District in the evening of 16/08. The attackers used small arms and RPGs during the attack. Four administration police officers were killed and local teacher was injured in the attack. The attackers also set fire to the police post, destroying its complex of buildings. Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for the attack on its Twitter account, claiming to have killed five police officers and seized weapons and communications equipment.
A man is hacked to death by unknown assailants at his home in Vitengeni, Kilifi county.
Defusal: Two bombs are discovered near soldiers of faith church in Huruma, Nairobi and were disabled before detonation. It is not clear if the soldiers were the intended target.

Twenty Al-Shabab militiamen are killed by the Kenya Defence Forces [KDF] near the border town of Hulugho, Garissa. The militants were crossing the border to Somalia and are believed to be part of a group of nearly 40 militiamen who attacked an Administration Police camp at Galmagala Division last Friday [16 August] evening killing four Administration Police officers.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. Specifically, this days clashes were in the Oda and Hellu area. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.
Tuk-tuk taxi operators protest newly implemented traffic routes and rules in downtown Mombasa.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.
Unidentified assailants petrol bomb a civilian couples house for unknown reason. They two suffered injury and were taken to a nearby hospital.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.
Kenyan forces stationed in Madera County chase several al Shabaab fighters into Beled Hawo following cross-border gunfire. Causalities not known.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Irate Bodaboda taxi Drivers from Limuru lynched a suspected motorbike thief after he was caught driving to a garage in Kwambira shopping centre. The mob was drown from Ngaraiga and Kamirithu villages. They beat the suspect known as Maina to death using stones, hardwood and metal bars.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

An Administration Police officer shot a businessman in Marakwet East before he was attacked and killed by an angry mob. It is not clear why the officer opened fire. The trader was rushed to the hospital and is expected to survive.

An Administration Police officer shot a businessman in Marakwet East before he was attacked and killed by an angry mob. It is not clear why the officer opened fire. The trader was rushed to the hospital and is expected to survive.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found.

Twenty are dead following fresh clashes between members of Borana and Gabra communities in Moyale. The clashes happened at Funan-nyatta area, about 35 kilometres from Moyale town. The clashes have been occurring sporadically over the course of ten days. The military has threatened to deploy to the area if peace isnt found. Many residents have fled the area.

Angry traders of Kangemi Market blocked a section of the Waiyaki way, later to be dispersed by police. The traders were protesting the demolition of the market by city county askaris the previous night. No report of violence.
Dassanach raiders enter Kenya near Lake Turkana, kill a police reservist and injure two others at a post at Loarengak.
A group of Ethiopian Dassanach cross the shared border and kill a police reservist along the west bank of the Lake Turkana.
A group of youths protest land developers from taking over a piece of land at the Imtiaz mosque on Lagos Road, in Nairobis central business district.
Eight people were killed in what is believed to be a revenge attack in Ntirango and Loliondo villages of Lolgorian division, Trans Mara West District.
Four suspected gangsters were lynched by an angry mob after they tried to rob a businessman in Viyalo village, Sabatia constituency, Vihiga County.
Waving twigs and placards more than 200 internally displaced persons demonstrated in Nyeri town, demanding to be relocated.
City/county labours protest the county governments failure to increase their salaries as agreed upon in their collective bargaining agreement.
Unionized striking labourers hold a demonstration outside city hall demanding increased pay.
More than 100 boda boda operators protest outside the DC offices over insecurity and theft in the area.
Striking county workers continue a salary protest.
An administrating police officer attack a 68 year old woman in Kakemer village in Teso North for unknown reason.
A woman is killed and two pupils seriously injured when Pokot raiders invaded Lokoron. The motive for the attack may have been ethic.
Striking county workers continue a salary protest.

Unidentified men riding in a taxi hurled a hand grenade at a police vehicle passing by the Nairobi Hotel in Manderas main market in the evening of 05/09. The group then directed small arms fire at the police, forcing the police to withdraw quickly, before their damaged vehicle broke down along the road to the police station. Three police officers and a civilian (a cashier at the Nairobi Hotel) were injured in the attack. The attackers managed to escape the scene without suffering any casualties.
A device suspected to be an IED exploded in front of the Central AP camp in Mandera in the evening of 05/09. No casualties were reported.
Following the shooting and killing of two attendants at a petrol station, local residents protest, calling for increased security in the area.

Al Shabaab militants shoot and kill two civilians at Mandera, a Kenya/Somali border town. On Thursday night, two police officers were seriously injured after a hand grenade was hurled into their vehicle.
A mob lynches a man they believe killed an 8-month-old child.
A group of residents of the Kibera slum in Nairobi protest forced removal.
Suspected police officers raid the Kimusu County home of a Norwegian missionary, killing and robbing him. The motivation for the attack is not known.
Three people were shot dead when armed assailants of Somali origin attacked a remote village in Malalani location, Kitui East constituency. The violence may have escalated from an argument.
After a pastor of a church attacked a parishioner during a private dispute 200 members of the church gather outside the church building to protest the behaviour.
A group of street traders protest the recent killing of a colleague by police. Some of the protesters assaulted a police officer and set his motorbike alight.
Six people were injured after they were attacked in a suspected land control disagreement.
A vigilante mob morning beat to death a suspected thief of a home in Kagaa village in Maragua.
Garre and Degodia militia clashed at Meriley water dam in Banissa District in the afternoon of 16/09. The two sides exchanged gunfire briefly. No causalities reported.

A student at Angata Barikoi Secondary School was shot dead by suspected Kuria cattle rustlers in Oldonyorok, Trans Mara West district. It is not clear if the attack was ethnically based. The attack occurred in the late evening of 16/09.
An attorney defending the Bungoma area Senator is assassinated for suspected political reasons.
A Isiolo tomato farmer is killed at Isiolo-Meru border in what the security agents say is a revenge attack from the Meru.
Four robbery suspects were set on fire at Kamwimbi by a vigilante group.
A robbery suspect is killed by a vigilante group.
Boda boda protesters demonstrate against government harassment after refusing to pay a highway levy.
Hundreds of boda boda operators demonstrated in Malindi town against increased cases of brutal murders of their colleagues by suspected street gangs.
Hundreds of women in Nandi County staged demonstrations against the sale of alcoholic drinks to school children.

Approximately one hour after the initial attack on the Westgate Mall, Kenyan security forces, including police and military, enter the building and begin engaging al Shabaab in gun battles. Running gun battles continue into the evening.
Troops and GUS personnel exchange fire in Westgate mall due to mistaken identity. 1 GSU officer dies.

column16: BBC News; New York Police Department
column17: Al Shabaab attacks pedestrians in a shopping centre during mid-day, arriving in three separate groups using three different entrances. 68 dead, including private security staff, 150+ injured over four days, hostages taken. Witnesses claim the attack was highly organised, with the attackers having pre-positioned weapons throughout the building, as well as obtaining access to service elevators. Following the attack al Shabaab claimed responsibility. There were claims the group specifically targeted non-Muslims. Foreigners were among those confirmed dead, including British, American, French, Canadians, Indians, a Ghanaian, a South African and a Chinese. The ordeal occurred over a four day period. Al Shabaab stated the reason for the attacks was the Kenyan military presence in Somalia.

column16: New York Police Department; Star (Kenya); AFP
column17: Kenyan forces battle with Al-Shabaab. Two soldiers are injured in a grenade attack. One gunmen is shot in the leg and does not reappear.

column16: New York Police Department; AFP; Star (Kenya); BBC News
column17: Al-Shabaab continues to shoot and execute civilians within Westgate Mall.
During battles with Al-Shabaab two Kenyan soldiers are killed and 11 are injured. Three of the injured die the next day from their wounds. Three of the Al Shabaab gunmen are killed during the day.

Kenyan forces continue assaults on al Shabaab positions within the Westgate Mall during the morning hours. Security forces claim they have gained control of all levels of the mall. Six additional deaths reported, including 11 injuries. 200 hostages rescued over the course of the sedge.
Al Shabaab continues to hold hostages for the third day while remain holed up in the Westgate Mall.

Early on the fourth day, a senior police source declared the operation to clear the building was ""over"", however journalists outside reported that sporadic gunfire was continuing. The confirmed death toll is 61 civilians, six security officers and five militants (72 total), plus 175 injuries. It is thought that the death toll could rise, as bodies could possibly concealed under the rubble. Authorities have said they have found ""some"" of the missing. 61 are still considered missing. Security forces are holding eight suspected al Shabaab militants in connection to the attack. The al Shabaab leader, Sheikh Ahmed Aw Abdi Godane ""Abu Zubeir,"" issued an audio message 25/09 on the Westgate attack in Nairobi. In his message the al Shabaab leader praised the perpetrators and explained that the attack was to punish Kenya for invading Somalia and killing vulnerable Muslims in Somalia.

Al Shabaab attackers hurled a hand grenade at a group of police officers patrolling the Army/Airport road near Basabra Supermarket in Wajir on the evening of 25/09. The police opened fire after the blast. A second explosion was heard shortly after the first. The cause of the second explosion is currently unclear. One person was killed and three others were injured. Police arrested an injured man they believed to be one the perpetrators.

Suspected al Shabaab attack Ifo refugee camp in Dadaab, targeting an international aid organization staff residence in the refugee camp, which is one among the five open air complex camps in region. There was no injury.

Al Shabaab fighters, reportedly ten in number, attacked the Central Administration Police camp in Mandera in the night of 26/09. The attackers exchanged small arms, hand grenades and RPGs for about 30 minutes after which they withdrew. Three vehicles parked in the compound got burnt in the fighting. Initial casualty reports indicate that two police officers were killed and one seriously wounded. One perpetrator was wounded in the attack. A conflicting report by the Nairobi Star holds three police deaths.

Police sentries in the main Mandera Police Line reportedly opened fire in the night of 27/09. The reason behind the shooting is unclear. Reports indicate that although police claim to have been fired upon, there is no evidence that an attack took place.

The Yiaku community living on Kurikuri Group Ranch in Mukogodo division protest at the border of the Kurikuri and Makurian group ranches in what they alleged was bias from the provincial administration over a land division conflict.

The more than 200 cross-border Ugandan-Pokot raiders attacked Apuko village in Pokot North and drove away the animals after a fierce morning battle with Pokot herdsmen and security officers. Causalities not known.

The more than 200 cross-border Ugandan-Pokot raiders attacked Apuko village in Pokot North and drove away the animals after a fierce morning battle with Pokot herdsmen and security officers. Causalities not known.

A crowd of squatters believed to be composed of Nandi youths invaded a farm belonging to a former judge and attacked an AP officer who was guarding the premise. The motive for the attack is believed to be concerning the control of land.

A former convict was killed in Embu for stealing a rabbit - - Residents of Itugu at Kiaragana in Embu East district found the suspect cooking rabbit meat. They frogmarched him to the Embu-Meru highway, assaulted him and set him on fire.

A prominent cleric and three others are assassinated outside Mombasa. The reason for the attack is not known. The following day a group of locals renewed a protest against the murder, which became violent. Some accusations held the police were involved in the assassination, though they have denied any involvement.
A man who allegedly killed this 100-year-old grandmother is lynched by a band of locals.
Shorty after the assassination of prominent cleric outside a mosque a group mobilised at the Masjid Musa mosque to protest the act.

A prominent cleric and three others are assassinated outside Mombasa. The reason for the attack is not known. The following day a group of locals renewed a violent protest against the murder, accusing the police of being involved. Four killed, seven injured and a church destroyed before police were able to disperse the rioters. Clashes with police reported. At least eleven arrested.

After a Boda boda rider was gunned down by a suspected police official for unknown reason, several of the victims delivery comrades protest the shooting. Several days later the group officially entered a labour strike in further protest. It is not clear when the protest to the shooting occurred, as it may have been the following day or later.

After a Boda boda rider was gunned down by a suspected police official for unknown reason, several of the victims delivery comrades protest the shooting. Several days later the group officially entered a labour strike in further protest.
An unknown group attacked a Giriama village near Kipini in the Tana River Delta, burning three homes.
Parents and teachers of a school protest a private land developer who has allegedly used a 1.5 acre plot belonging to the school for his own purposes.
Slum dwellers gather at the Lands Ministry to protest recent forced evictions.
A group of police who were returning from patrol opened fire on a group of men planting an IED along the side of the road the night of 11/10. The police failed to hit or capture any of the men.
A young boy is killed and three others injured after a landmine detonated in Mandera border town. The group many have been playing with the mine, not aware that it was dangerous.

Residents protest the lack of title deeds provided by the government in Macalder town in Nyatike district. They asked President Uhuru and Lands Secretary Charity Ngilu to give them the deeds to their property.
A man is shot and killed with arrows along the on the Chemelil-Nandi border. The reason for the attack is not known.
Renewed ethnic clashes in Moyale Monday (October 14th) injured at least five people and led to parts of the city being shut down.

Students at the Kirinyaga University College protest for the removal of the institutions principal due to an increase of student fees. Police engage the group and there are several accounts of violence between them.
Students of Tsimba Secondary School in Kwale on demonstrated to protest what they said is mistreatment by their principal.
A Christian church leader is murdered late in the evening by unknown assailants.
Four people have died following inter-Tribal conflict in Waso Rongai Village, Baragoi. The groups involved were not identified.

Two masked men armed with AK type rifles came to a small cinema in block N-29 of IFO 1 in Dadaab District in the night of 17/10. The motive of the attack is unknown. Six people were injured in the attack. The perpetrators escaped. It is believed the attackers are affiliated with al Shabaab.
A Christian church leader is murdered by unknown assailants.
A church pastor is ""hacked to death"" by an unidentified assailant.
A vigilante mob burns the home of a suspected murderer, killing his two children. Several days later the suspect died of injuries sustained from the fire.
A suspected motorbike thief is lynched a vigilante group and nearly killed before he is rescued by police.
Bar owners protest unjust regulatory practices by the government.

Street hawkers operating in Nakuru town protest against allocation of public land to two developers. The hawkers marched to the Kenya Railways yard and brought down a wire fence said to have been erected by the developers.
About 200 pupils of Osasame Primary School in Teso North protest the lack of instructional materials.
A group of Muslims protest over two days over the recent arrest of a Tanzanian cleric who was accused of attempting to radicalise local youth.
Residents in Keroka protest poor delivery services.
A suspected goat thief is lynched by a vigilante mob.

Kenyas anti-riot police officers arrested dozens of youths protesting the arrest of radical Muslim cleric in the coastal city of Mombasa. The youths blocked sections of the road outside the Masjid Musa Mosque in Mombasa and engaged police in running battle.

Political separatists of the Mombasa Republican Council (MRC) attack a police post in Palakumi, Kilifi, injuring one officer. According to Kilifi County AP Commandant Elijah Ngetich, 10 suspected MRC militants, armed with arrows and bows, carried out the midnight raid at Palakumi in Ganze. The motive has not been established although some claim they were out to steal weapons.
A group of Muslims protest over two days over the recent arrest of a Tanzanian cleric who was accused of attempting to radicalise local youth.
Tullow Oil Kenya halts production due to demonstrations by area residents demanding to be employed at the companies sites, including Ngamia 1 and Twiga 1, which are its biggest operations.
Sugarcane growers blockade Enoosaen-Awendo road with lit fires in protest of cane prices.
A group of jobless youth in Kitui have protest the high qualifications set by the county in employing its staff.
Street vendors gather to protest the killing of their donkeys by suspected thieves.
Othaya More than 100 students from Kagonye Mixed Secondary School in Othaya, Nyeri county stage a walk-out from their classes in protest of school administration.

A university student is killed and one shot in the leg by police in demonstrations in Maralal over insecurity. Several shops and offices have closed in the area due to fear of looting as protestors engage police in running battles.
Several hundred Kenyan protesters marched on police headquarters to deliver a petition demanding justice after a young girl is raped.
Residents of Flamingo estate in Nakuru town protest poor area sanitation.

More than 200 residents of Ragati village of Karatina, Nyeri protest the alleged grabbing of community land. They marched to the Mathira East sub county commissioners office where they accused their chief and senior lands officers of aiding unscrupulous businessmen to grab more than six acres set aside for social amenities in the village.

Youth in Limuru barricaded the Nairobi-Nakuru Highway protesting against a Kiambu County financial bill. The bill proposes to charge fees for county cemeteries, church crusades and slaughtering of animals among other charges proposed by the county government.
Police shoot and injure a squatter during a forced eviction of them from a piece of land. The shooting was in response to a series of running battles between the squatter and police.

A group of youth blocked the Kitui-Machakos road to protest against sand harvesting at Tiva River. The youth put boulders at Mulutu trading centre at 7am to intercept lorries ferrying sand from the river.

Three people were shot dead after youths armed with arrows attacked Ruga police post in Muhoroni Sub County. The three are reported to have been shot dead in an arrow and fire exchange at Nyangore sub-location in Chemelil. The youths are suspected to have come from Nandi community. The youths had vowed to kill a senior police officer, accusing police of contributing to the rampant chaos along the nearby border area.

Two students were killed at Laikipia University. The first died accidentally when a traffic police officer driving on the Nyahururu- Nakuru road knocked him down at Nyumba Tatu trading centre. The accident triggered a riot by the university students that culminated in the killing of yet another student as Nyahururu police engaged the students in running battles.

A middle aged Pokot man was shot and killed while grazing animals at Chepurwo village in Ombolion location by suspected armed raiders from the neighbouring county. The raiders did not steal the victims animals.

Residents of Sala Location in Tana River County at the weekend staged protests against a company building the 37.5 billion Sala Gravity Canal. The protest arose over differences between the residents and the company over employment opportunities and sub-contracts for locals.
Journalists in Northern Kenya took to the streets to protest a recently passed media bill which they believe would set limits on the press freedom.
A man is shot and injured by cattle thieves at Sosian location in Laikipia West Sub-County.
AP officers in Kisumu protest against rampant ongoing theft in their houses. The group pushed for greater security.
A police officer is shot twice, in the head and back, by two unknown gunmen on a motorcycle at around 8.30pm at Afisi ya Kanu stage in Mwandoni Ndogo.
University students from Kenya Science campus blocked a section of Ngong road to protest poor management of the institution. Police were on the scene, but did not engage the group.
Unidentified assailants attack the kill the parents of an MP. It is not clear if the attack was platonically motivated.
A clash between Ganze police and MRC youths leads to a gunshot wound of a bystander civilian.
An unidentified gunmen is killed and a police officer is wounded after the gunmen launched an attack in the Lexington area of Nairobi. The motive for the attack is not known.

Police shoot and kill two ""militants"" in the Eastleigh area or Nairobi. Their affiliation was not reported. Nairobi County commander Benson Kibue has said that the suspects are believed to be the gang that hurled a grenade that killed two people and seriously injured Kamukunji MP Yusuf Hassan in December last year. Human Rights Watch has of late contested this claim stating witnesses have claimed the two (Lenox David Swalleh and an unidentified person) where shot without warning while leaving a mosque.
1,000 market traders protest a move by the Taita-Taveta County Government to relocate them near the Kenya-Tanzania border.

Hundreds of residents from Kwanza constituency converged at Namanjalala along Namanjalala Zea road today and demonstrated against impassable roads. Carrying placards and chanting songs for their rights, the residents planted bananas on the road from Namanjalala to Liyavo, a distance of two kilometres, blaming local government officials.
An unidentified man hacks a woman to death in a land dispute.
A vigilante mob killed two men after accusing them of being witch doctors.

column9: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross and Red Crescent; Health Workers (Kenya); Aid Workers (Kenya)
column17: A Red Cross officer is shot and injured by an armed group after delivering supplies to Nakwamoru village.

Residents of Maili Tisa in Kwanza constituency hold a demonstration to protest impassable roads. The residents, mostly farmers, said it is difficult for them to transport maize and milk to nearby Kitale town for sale.

A suspected rapist is lynched by a mob in Kiritiri. Eye witnesses said the residents pounced on him and tied his hands and legs with a rope before starting battering him with all manner of weapons. Police rescued the man shortly before death.
Two men were in the evening hours shot dead at Kasses village in West Pokot by suspected raiders.

A section of Kenya Institute of Mass Communication students are on the rampage protesting the construction of a private building on a piece of land they claim belongs to the institution at South B, Nairobi. Police and witnesses say the students have blocked Kiganjo road and are demolishing the house in question.

A group of youths in Mandara stoned cars, burnt tires and engaged police in protest of the arrest of their friend. Fifteen of the protesters were arrested as a result of the demonstration. Police report they had sustained injuries.
A vigilante group lynches two on suspicion of witchcraft.

Protesters, angered over parliamentary bills which limit press freedom, marched through the streets of Nairobi to present a petition of voters to lawmakers. This protest is unrelated to Miscellaneous Amendment Bill protesters, occurring either elsewhere or at a different time in the city.

Residents in Narok block the entire Mai Mahiu Narok highway near Lake Turkana to protest the killing of about 40 goats by a lorry the previous evening. The group who saw the road as treacherous demanded they be compensated for their loss. The protest disrupted traffic, but caused no reported damage.
A group marches to demand that the government withdraws the Miscellaneous Amendment Bill on the NGOs from Parliament.

Armed Pokot militiamen attack and hold hostage three police posts in Lorokon village. It is not clear how many police officers are effected by the attack. Causalities not known. The siege is likely related to a border dispute between the Pokots and Turkana communities that has been causing tension in the area.
Al Shabaab attacks a civilian bus near Mandera, killing 28

Police forces launch an operation to retake police posts occupied by Pokot militia. The Pokot militiamen responded with ""heavy resistance."" It is not clear if the operation was successful. Causalities not known.
A group of street traders protest a proposed move of their booths by blocking roads with their wares.
Residents of Adungosi trading centre forcefully evicted 30 suspected criminals from their homes in Teso. No reported causalities.

Residents of Ngerenya village in Kilifi county protest a high crime rate in their area. The group demanded redeployment of administration police officers withdrawn from Ngerenya before the March 4 general elections.
Three suspected gangsters are lynched by a group of vigilante villagers in Kisauni district.

A group of ""radical Muslim youths"" raid a mosque attempting to attack the resident imam, who was inside delivering a sermon. Inside, a group of youths came to the defence of the imam, clashing with the intruders. Several reported injuries reported as result of the clash. Police later arrived to disperse the warring sides.

A group of ""radical Muslim youths"" raid a mosque attempting to attack the resident imam, who was inside delivering a sermon. Inside, a group of youths came to the defence of the imam, clashing with the intruders. Several reported injuries reported as result of the clash. Police later arrived to disperse the warring sides.

Traffic was disrupted along the busy Kitale-Lodwar road after angry Pokot residents blocked it at several points, causing vehicles to stop over at the Marich police station. The group was protesting the death of a motorcycle mechanic who was murdered in previous days.
Suspected Borana militia attack two lorries in the Sololo and Woldaa areas outside Moyale, which are a few kilometres apart. No reported causalities.
Turkana militia raid Orwa town in West Pokot, killing a young boy and destroying property. In an act of revenge the villagers of Orwa mobilized, killing a man in the nearby Turkana village of Runo.
Turkana militia raid Orwa town in West Pokot, killing a young boy and destroying property. In an act of revenge the villagers of Orwa mobilized, killing a man in the nearby Turkana village of Runo.
A man is abducted and beheaded at Ngomeni in Malindi by a suspected, unnamed named Muslim group.
Al Shabaab attacks quary workers near Mandera on 02/12, killing 38.
A madrassa teacher is beheaded for unknown reason in Malindi.

Three brothers were burnt to death after an eviction exercise turned chaotic in Kisauni. The three, including a village elder, were first beaten and set on fire by irate mob after the were accused of colluding with a private developer to grab the contentious land. Mtopanga Ward representative Lucy Chizi said two of the bodies were burnt beyond recognition.
Journalists protest against a proposed amendment to the Kenya Information and Communication Bill through the streets of Eldoret.
Journalists in Nyeri and Kiambu gather to protest a proposed media law that would limit press freedom.
Journalists protest against a proposed amendment to the Kenya Information and Communication Bill through the streets of Kitui.
A group of journalists from Kilifi and Malindi gathered in Malindi town and demonstrated against a proposed media bill.
Journalists hold a silent demonstration to protest the proposed amendment to the Kenya Information and Communication Bill which will limit their freedom.
Journalists in Nyeri and Kiambu gather to protest a proposed media law that would limit press freedom.

At least 12 people were killed with many others injured in Marsabit county of northern Kenya following clashes between rival militia groups, Borana and Burji, Gabra. The clash caused 30,000 nearby Moyale residents, fearing for their safety, to flee north into Ethiopia. Clashes were sporadic throughout the week, though no specific date is provided. Some sources have causality totals at 70 or more.

Residents of Mumias town protest threats by Kakamega Governor Wycliffe Oparanya to evict Mumias Sugar Company managers from the firm. Traders closed their shops to join the protestors who sang anti-Oparanya songs. The residents wished the government would subsidise the company financially.

Journalists in Nandi held a peaceful demonstration on Kapsabet town streets to protest a proposed media bill. The scribes appealed to MPs to reject it as they believe it would violate the constitution.
A 13-year-old boy is shot and killed by suspected Turkana raiders in Kamurio village on Pokot-Turkana border.
A man suspected to be a boda boda thief is lynched by a group of vigilantes.
A man is lynched by a group of boda boda operators for the suspected murder of their colleague two weeks ago. The man was rescued by police before death.
A Christian preacher is gunned down by two unidentified men at Tiwi in Ukunda. The reason for the assassination is not known.
Seventeen are killed in ongoing ethnic clashes over a 36 hour period Butiye village in Moyale town.

Police forces gun down Hassan Suleiman Mwayuyu, an al Shabaab suspect while travelling by bus. The Kenya Standard reported a battle between the actors, but HRW conflicted this story. Police believed Mwayuyu had be planning grenade attacks on Mombasa.
Seventeen are killed in ongoing ethnic clashes over a 36 hour period Butiye village in Moyale town.
Ethnic clashes continue near Moyale on 07/12. ""Dozens"" reported dead.

Two General Service Unit officers (paramilitary wing of the Kenyan Military) were injured when a vehicle they were travelling in was attacked in West Pokot county. The attackers may have been thieves.
Al Shabaab launches an attack on a border town, killing three civilians and five police. Liboi hosts an AMISOM military, often used to supply forces in Somalia.
Street traders in Kisumu protest an increased amount of street crime occurring in their area. The protest was held at the town square of Kisumu.
University of Nairobi students riot in protest of a power blackout. Police forces disperse the group with teargas. No injury reported.
An unidentified person threw a hand grenade into a group of British tourists in the Likoni area of Mombasa. The grenade failed to explode.
The bodies to two men are discovered in Kilifi, having been shot at close range. The attackers and their motivations are not known.

Two people were killed and at least three others injured in two explosions targeting police officers in the north-eastern Kenyan town of Wajir. The explosions took place near the Baraza park in the town. The injured were taken to Wajir general hospital. Reports say there have been several arrests in connection with the explosions.

Suspected al Shabaab attackers detonate an explosive on a public bus, killing four and injuring 30 in the Pangani-Eastleigh section of the city. Eastleigh is known for its large population of ethnic Somalis, and may have been the specific target of the attackers. In the following days the death toll from the blast rose to six.

A University of Nairobi student is shot and killed by police during a student-led riot near the central police station. The police also implemented tear gas. The protesters established themselves outside the station after one of their classmates committed suicide while in police custody.
Matau operators in Mwingi Central district protest the influx of probox vehicles in Mwingi town. The group claimed the probox vehicles do not have hold the proper certifications.

More than 300 residents from Kamukunji village in Solia, Nakuru held a peaceful demonstration over a power black out that has lasted for five days. The residents said the Kenya Power has not rectified the problem despite numerous reports.
Sand miners and transporters blocked Mombasa Road at Mlolongo Town for close to five hours in protest of an alleged police shooting of one of their co-workers the previous evening.
Employees of a supermarket chain boycott their shifts and demonstrate for higher pay.

A Muslim cleric has been shot dead by two gunmen at Kona ya Musa in Diani, Kwale county. The cleric was shot in the head unknown people a few metres from his business some minutes after evening prayers on 18/12.
At least two people were shot dead, and four others injured in a gun attack in Wajir town. This is the second attack in a week. A gunman shot the victims indiscriminately before escaping.
A prominent cleric is shot and killed in Ukunda, his killers escaped by motorbike. According to police reports the cleric was specifically targeted.
A group of youths, suspected to be members or supports of the MRC petrol bomb two churches during the early morning hours. Causalities not known.
Young ""street"" boys pelt passing motorists and police with stones as assault a passerby for unknown reason. One of the boys was shot and killed by police.
Members of the Muslim community of Mai Mahout, Naivete protest the move by the provincial administration to ban Madrassa due to controversial teachings.
Three men suspected of killing an elderly man were lynched by a mob at Likuyani in Kakamega county.

An explosive device believed to be an IED targeted a police vehicle in the vicinity of Juba Primary School in Dagahley Camp in Dadaab District in the morning of 30/12. The police vehicle was escorting an NGO vehicle carrying out borehole refuelling. One police officer was reportedly injured by the explosion. The vehicle was severely damaged.

A Kenya police reservist was shot dead by unidentified armed raiders in a fresh attack at Turkwel on Pokot-Turkana border. The police officer of the Turkana ethnic group, though it was not clear if ethnicity was the motive for the attack.
Residents of Rironi shopping centre in Kiambu county protest a recent high crime wave.
A group of vigilante residents of Kiarango Village in Embu West District lynch a suspected coffee thief.
A band of residents of Gathuri village in Maragua constituency, Muranga county have torched the houses of two old women suspected of practicing witchcraft. No reported injury or death.

At least ten are injured in a grenade attack at a nightclub in Diani, 25km outside of Mombasa. The attack occurred around 4am. Witnesses claim they saw an individual lob the explosive into a group of people, though the persons identity remain unknown. The target of the blast may have been a group of British tourists present in the bar.

Four people were killed at Odha area, 15 kilometres from Moyale [northeastern Kenya] town following fresh tribal skirmishes in Moyale District between the Boranas and Gabbras. The clash was believed to have been sparked by the use of a water hole. The clash took place during the evening hours. In an effort to maintain order, military reservists were sent to the area in the following days.
One person is injured after suspected al Shabaab detonated an explosive in the Somali-populated Eastleigh district of Nairobi.
A man is killed by a band of vigilantes over suspected theft.
A hand grenade is thrown at a police officer in the Diani area. The ordinance did not explode. The perpetrators escaped.
A hand grenade is thrown at a police vehicle in Ukunda. The five officers present escaped unhurt.
A middle-aged man was killed in the morning hours by a vigilante mob in Majaoni, Kilifi county. It was believed the man was accused of planning the killing of his sister-in-law.
Parents of students enrolled at a primary school protest near its entrance, demanding the head teachers transfer following a poor school-wide test result.

A man is lynched by a group of residents over suspected theft. Another suspected thief was killed by a mob on in nearby Koimugo village in Embu town days earlier. It is not clear if the two vigilante groups are related.

An unknown number of people are feared dead (coded as 3) and several others injured in Marsabit following fresh attacks by bandits believed to be from Ethiopia. The attack comes just days after four people were killed in the relative area over a water hole dispute, though it is not clear if this attack was motivated by ethnicity.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.
One is killed and two are others injured in a ethnic clash over the course of two days.

Three IEDs were detonated in the vicinity of firewood distribution centre in IFO 1 (Dadaab District) in the morning of 08/12. Reports indicate that the first explosion targeted the rear police escort vehicle of the regular morning convoy to IFO 1 and Dagahaley. The second set targeted the police responders, of whom a number had by then arrived at the scene. No one was injured by any of the blasts. The police vehicle initially targeted by the perpetrators only sustained slight damages. There were gunshots fired by the police after the second explosion. One man was injured in its aftermath, trampled by a panicked crowd running from the scene.

A group of youth riot, apparently in an effort to disrupt an election in Kiranja. The youth, some of whom were intoxicated, engaged police in fierce fights. Police manning the polling centre had to call for reinforcement from Kerugoya town. Three people were injured during the fracas. The intended effect of the unrest was to aid a local candidate who the youth perceived to be beneficial to farmers.

column9: FORD-Kenya: Forum for the Restoration of Democracy-Kenya
column17: Unidentified gunmen open fire on Bungoma senator-elect Moses Wetangulas car during the evening hours along Mbagathi Way. The Senator escaped unhurt.
A man suspected of stealing motorcycles is lynched in Laikipia West.
Students staged a sit-in protest, shutting down their against the transfer of their principal.
Staff at the University of Nairobi protest the non-payment of allowances.
Mtune villagers at Vanga-LungaLunga in Kwale protest lack of water, secondary schools and health facilities.

Unidentified militia, believed to be from nearby Ethiopia attack the ethnic Gabra border town of North Horr, killing two police and injuring ""scores"" of civilians. It was reported cattle was stolen in the raid.

Hawkers, boda boda operators and small kiosk owners protest against the Meru county governments move to demolish their kiosks and introduce new tax levies. The protestors, who lit fires along the roads in Meru town, engaged police officers in running battles. The police lobbed tear gas canisters and used live bullets to disperse the crowd. A passerby sustained gunshot wounds on his leg during the demo.

Hawkers and traders again protest the planned demolition of their kiosks by the state government in order to improve a nearby road. Demonstrations became violent, one reported dead and two others sustaining gunshot wounds. No report of police presence.
Parents of enrolled students gathered at Pap Oriang Primary school in Siaya county to protest the transfer of its head teacher.

A blast of unknown origin occurs at Jomo Kenyatta International Airport during the evening hours. The body of a Somali national was later discovered, however his causes of death is believed to be from gunfire. Nevertheless, authorities believe his death is related to the blast perpetrators. The following three days several arrests were made.

A senior Mijikenda Kayak elder was shot dead by unknown gangsters during the evening hours at his home in Jamb area of Wartime. Family members said the man had no local grudges and they had no idea of the motive.
Street traders situated in the Central Business District of the city protest a planned forced eviction of the area.

Kiaga Coffee Factory farmers demonstrate outside the company premises in protest of slated sale plans. The protesters believed the planned sale to a cooperative society, which typically pay less than that of private millers.

Police have dispersed over 5000 traders who took to the street to protest hiking of county levies and brought business to a standstill in Thika town. The protesters accused the Kiambu County Government of increasing the county levies by over 100 % and demanded that Governor William Gitau Kabogo leave office. Following the demonstration the trader found their shops had been looted. It is not clear if there is a connection between the demonstration and the robbery.
Traders in Muranga have protest against new tax rates proposed by the county government. The demonstrations began late 21/01 and continued into 22/01.
Traders in Muranga have protest against new tax rates proposed by the county government. The demonstrations began late 21/01 and continued into 22/01.
More than 300 traders operating in Nakuru town staged a demonstration along Nakuru, Eldoret highway after they found their stalls destroyed by officers of county government.

Several people including police officers were injured after police and demonstrators protesting against a roadside court in Embu town clashed. The protestors, who were mainly matatu operators, are opposed to the court that had been set up on Embu-Nairobi to charge traffic offenders.

Traders riot, attack police and engage in running battles after they are forcibly removed from their vending locations near the Central Business District. Several hawkers were arrested as police used tear gas to disperse them during the confrontation.

Ethiopian Merrile militia attack a group of fishermen in the north-west Turkana border district, on Lake Turkana, killing one and injuring several others. The motive for the attack is not clear, though several similar raid had been persistent in the area. Responding to the fishermens distress calls, Kenyan police battled the Merrile, pushing them back into Ethiopia. No causality figures provided from the police battle.

Ethiopian Merrile militia attack a group of fishermen in the north-west Turkana border district, on Lake Turkana, killing one and injuring several others. The motive for the attack is not clear, though several similar raid had been persistent in the area. Responding to the fishermens distress calls, Kenyan police battled the Merrile, pushing them back into Ethiopia. No causality figures provided from the police battle.
Traders in Kinoo demonstrated against ""punitive"" levies. They closed down their businesses before marching for five kilometres to the Kinoo sub county offices in Kikuyu town.
A group of youth protest a rally held in Kisumu by Cord leaders.
Four people have been confirmed dead after raiders, suspected to be Pokots, ambushed Turkana herdsmen at Juluk in Turkana South sub-county.

Students of Mosoriot Teachers Training College in Nandi held demonstrations following the suspicious death of their colleague. They are also opposed to a plan to upgrade the institution into a university. The more than 1,000 students barricaded the busy Eldoret-Kapsabet-Kisumu highway with huge boulders. Police shot into the air to disperse the group.

Tambach High School in Elgeyo Marakwet has been closed following student protests during the night time hours. The students were protesting the banning of weekend night entertainment and teacher harassment. Police were called in after the students threatened to destroy property.
Coffee farmers demonstrate in the streets surrounding their factory over pay.

The more than 200 youth, armed with weapons raided a sand harvesting site in Kedong Ranch and set the lorries ablaze. The attack follows a fall-out between traders and the youth from Mai Mahiu over control of the sand business.

Nine are feared dead in Moyale as fights between Borana and Gabra-Burji militia. On the morning of 30/01 suspected Gabra-Burji militias attacked Kate village, some 50 kilometres from Moyale town. The Borana group responded with heavy resistance. After about half an hour of intense exchange, the fights moved from the village into the bush. As at 11am fierce exchange was heard towards Funan-nyata about 15 kilometres from Kate.
Arrests: Police in Eastleigh arrest over 100 Somali expatriates with suspected connections to al Shabaab in a night time operation.
During a police raid on Masjid Msa Mosque crowds in surrounding area hurled stones at the police.

A police officer and two youths are killed in a confrontation at the Masjid Musa Mosque in Mombasa. Police had stormed the mosque to arrest youths who were suspected to have been holding an al Shabaab recruitment meeting. At time of the raid the mosque was donned with al-Shabaab flags. Following the raid a three hour battle ensued, wile the youths, holed up in the Mosque mounted a resistance. Police fired teargas canisters to smoke them out of the mosque and in the process a police officer was killed. Two youths were also shot dead by police and several other people injured. 129 arrests reported, a court later charged all with being members of al Shabaab. Twenty-one were released in the following week.

Youths demanding the release of a group of youths who had been arrested following during fighting after police stormed a meeting in Masjid Msa Mosque riot. Police fired tear gas and rubber bullets at the protesters who were hurling rocks and shouting ""release our brothers"". Twenty-one arrested.

Police battle stone throwing youth for a second day in Mombasa. The confrontation between police armed with rubber bullets and the youth forced businesses near the Masjid Msa Mosque to shut down as roads were blocked and cars smashed.
Kenyan journalists have joined international journalists outside the Egyptian Embassy in Nairobi to protest the imprisonment of three Al Jazeera correspondents in Cairo.
A bomb was in the early morning hurled at a primary school in Likoni, Mombasa. Police say the device exploded inside the school compound, but no injuries have been reported.

Ten people were arrested as 300 Muslim youth engaged police in running battles in Kisauni, angered a recent raid on a nearby Mosque. Additionally, three passers-by were stabbed, robbed and seriously injured over cover of the melee. The violence occurred in the early afternoon.
A suspected cattle thief, believed to be a Ugandan, was killed by residents of Ochude location in Teso South district.

A Kenya police officer was shot and wounded by suspected al-Shabaab adherent in coastal town of Ukunda in Kwale district. Security officials in Kenyas coastal city of Mombasa said police officer was shot at close range by a gunmen riding in a motorbike before escaping with his gun.

Residents of Got Nyango village in Karachuonyo sub county, Homa Bay county held a peaceful demonstration over iron ore mining in the area. The residents said the company has not honoured the agreement they made previously.
A gay rights group protested outside the Ugandan Embassy against Ugandan homosexuality laws.
Lorry and matatu drivers and touts protested against the poor state of the Makutano-Alale road in Makutano town, West Pokot county.
Hotel and bar attendants protest for higher wages.

More than 300 clerics in Nyeri county protested against the proposed county Finance Bill on 12/02. They peacefully demonstrated in the town against the introduction of taxes and levies in churches by the county government.

A group of men from Kericho West attacked Nyakach during the overnight hours in revenge over stolen cattle. Several houses were torched, leaving many displaced and homeless. No report of death or injury. The exact date of the raid is not clear.

Homa Bay town residents paralysed business at the county assembly after members of the county assembly members rejected five candidates nominated as chief officers. The demonstrators backed by hundreds of boda boda operators tried to storm the assembly chambers to evict the MCAs but were stopped by anti-riot police. No violence reported.

Police use tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse a group of anti-government corruption protest in Nairobis CBD. The group accused the government of mishandling US aid. The group had planned to march to the National Assembly building before the authorities had deemed the demo illegal.
Kaya elders, backed by human rights activists, demonstrated in the streets of Kilifi to condemn the killing of an elder as well as the police reaction, which they believed is indifference.

Youth from Endorois community engaged police in a riot. The chaos led to the closing of Nyahururu- Kinamba Road for long hours. The youth were protesting against alleged grabbing of a 1,600 acre plot at Tuiyobei in Marigat district, Baringo. No reported causalities.
Mombasa county government chief inspector of Logistic and Planning is shot and killed, along with his companion. The assailants are believed to be of or in league with al Shabaab.

Students of Rongo University demonstrated against the death of their colleague. They blocked the busy Rongo-Migori road as police lobbed teargas canisters in the air to disperse them. The students said their colleague, a first year student bio-chemistry student, died due to alleged negligence by the administration. During the protest students vandalised and looted shops in Rongo town and near by shopping centres.

A man is killed in Taveta following fighting over a land dispute. Witnesses said the deceased, who is the land owner, had gone to mark the boundary of their land at Makongeni area when they were attacked by unknown assailants.

Makueni MP Daniel Maanzo and his wife are admitted at the Nairobi hospital after they were attacked and injured by armed thugs at their home. The attackers also stole cash and other valuables. It is not clear if the attack had political motivations.
Residents of Central Kadem location, Nyatike constituency have lynched a man for poisoning their cows.

Members of the Sikh protest the lobbying of a Christian group to remove a sacred statue. No report of violence, though reports describe the protesters as a ""mob."" Exact date of the protest is not known.

Members of the Ogiek community protest against the bid to evict them from the disputed Ngongogeri Farm in Nakuru County by police authorities. Government authorities claimed the settlers were harming the local wildlife.
Residents of Ogwedhi kill two suspected cattle rustlers.
More than 5,000 traders in Muhoroni sub county have threatened to boycott paying taxes due to lack of proper market facilities during a demonstration.
A homosexual is assaulted by her neighbours in the Kasarani area. Exact date unknown.

Three people were injured after a gang of about 10 people attacked worshipers at a church in Bamburis Mwembe Legeza area in Mombasa during the morning hours morning. The reason for the attack is not clear.
Residents of Kidarajani area in Bamburi lynched three suspected criminals during the morning hours.

Six people were injured during a confrontation between farmers and pastoralists at Mtondoni area in Hongwe ward, Lamu West district. The conflict ensued when pastoralists were accused of driving their animals into the farms and destroying crops. The identities of the two groups is not known.

Two hundred Thika boda operators and quarry workers and owners from Munyu in Thika East yesterday protested over poor roads. They said the Munyu-Makongeni road is impassable leading to loses. The protestors walked from Makongeni estate to the Kiambu county headquarters in Thika and demanded to be addressed by Governor William Kabogo or Deputy Governor Gerald Githinji. They were however stopped from entering the offices by the county government security guards and told to send representatives.
Sugarcane farmers in Trans Mara District protest a tax on their product.
Two middle-aged men were killed by a mob at Sigor centre in West Pokot county during the evening hours. They had been mistaken for child traffickers.

A group of farmers clashed with pastoralists over grazing land around Lake Naivasha. The farmers who claim to be members of the Mau Mau group accused the herders of driving their animals into the farms. Causalities not known or reported.
Farmers protest against ""strict rules"" on obtaining subsidized fertilizer.
Bondeni residents in Mvita constituency protested over the increased use of drugs by youths.
Owners and drivers of matatus and taxis block roads within Nairobi to protest over increased parking fees. Arrests reported.

Traders and residents of Kakamega town held a demonstration to protest against the taxes imposed by the county government. At one point, the demonstration turned violent with the protestors engaging the police in running battles.
A man was lynched by Embu Town residents after he was suspected of planning to con an Em-pesa operator of her cash.
Suspected al Shabaab fighters hurl hand grenades at a border post, but caused no injury. It is believed the ordinance may have partially malfunctioned.
Two al Shabaab members are killed by police during a raid in the Dadaab refugee complex.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines. Of the dead, two were killed on 07/03 and three on 08/03.
Residents held a peaceful demonstration over the poor state of Mpeketoni District Hospital.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines.

Five persons has been killed and several houses burned in a row pitying residents over a controversial piece of land at Urumwe Mukaro settlement scheme in Marmanet, Nyahururu. Several other people sustained injuries after residents clashed over the course of three days. It is not clear if the combatants were divided along ethnic lines.

Students of Kisii University hold a two day protest against the schools vice chancellor. The protest reportedly became violent after police engaged the protesters. Injuries not known. It was announced the university will be closed indefinitely after the second day of rioting.
Two suspected kidnappers were lynched during the night-time hours at Teret in Njoro.

Students of Kisii University hold a two day protest against the schools vice chancellor. The protest reportedly became violent after police engaged the protesters. Injuries not known. It was announced the university will be closed indefinitely after the second day of rioting.
Residents of Karuina in Embu West district burnt 28-year-old Antony Kariuki to death during the morning hours for entering a grocery shop through the roof and stealing.
A former ally of slain Muslim cleric sheikh Aboud Rogo was this morning critically injured by a unidentified group of youths.

An unknown number of armed men carried out an armed attack against the Central AP camp in Mandera in the night of 13-14/03. Employing multiple vectors, they first lobbed two hand grenades into the camp and subsequently fired against the police for a few minutes before departing the scene. One Police reservist was killed and another wounded in the aftermath of the attack. The KPRs were reportedly having a small break after long hours of patrolling around that area. The perpetrators reportedly crossed over to the Somali side of the border after the attack.
Residents protest traffic fines from police, believing they are overly hash and unwarranted. Exact date of the protest vague.

More than 150 families from Manda-Maweni village in Lamu county have protest the alleged grabbing of a quarry. The families stormed the county government offices and demanded that a tycoon in the area be ordered to leave.

Residents of Mukogodo division in Laikipia North district demonstrated against ""sand theft"". They said they have been deprived of revenue. The residents obstructed the Ilpolei-Doldol road for several hours, blocking lorries that transport sand from the collection points.

Youths from Othaya protested over a local CDF project, saying they were left out of its construction. The youths from Witima village said there was favouritism in the award of the tender for the Sh1.5 million Unjiru Community Hall.
Traders whose shops were last week demolished by the West Pokot government held a peaceful demonstration in Makutano town. They said the government gave them a short notice before the demolition.
Residents of Butere constituency demonstrated against MP Andrew Tobosos portraits on CDF projects. They said Toboso has been using CDF projects for political mileage.

One person was shot dead and another is fighting for his life at the Mandera Hospital after sustaining serious head injuries after suspected al Shabaab shot them at close range. (Though authorities believe al Shabaab is responsible, they also speculate job rivalry may have been a motive for the attack.
Warring between the Auliyan and Abdiwak clans causes the destruction of homes and the displacement of many in Qabobey, Garissa county. No causalities reported.

Suspected al Shabaab shot and killed four people attending a church service in Likoni, outside of Mombasa. Many more were reported wounded. In the following days the death toll was raised to six. Police forces launched a large operation which yielded the arrests of 59 suspects.

Two people were injured during a street protest against the Nandi government in Kapsabet town - A group of youth demonstrating over alleged corruption, nepotism and being sidelined in tendering for projects were confronted by a rival group supporting Governor Cleophas Lagat.
Residents of Karaini lynch a man on suspicion of murder.
Kenyans protested against discrimination and harassment by Ugandan security forces on the island. The Ugandan police have arbitrarily arrested fisherman and disallowed fishing in certain areas.
One dead in land dispute violence.
Five herdsmen sustained gunshot wounds during a cattle raid at Nadome village in Tiaty sub county, Baringo. The suspects are believed to be Turkana.

""One UN staff member was shot in the leg by five armed robbers who broke into his personal residence and stole valuables; he was hospitalized and is in stable condition. The robbers also killed one security guard.""
Five are attacked and set alight by unknown assailants. The motive for the attack is not known, but two of this victims are notable business personalities. Only injury reported.
Police forces shot and kill two al Shabaab suspects believed to be in connection with an attack on a church on 23/03.
A rioting mob torched a car and unintentionally killed a pedestrian. Police came and ""contained the situation."" The reason for the unrest is not known.
A man is dead after the explosive device he was assembling detonated during construction. Police suspect ""sympathizers of Somali Islamic extremists.""

Three simultaneous blasts occur in the Somali populated Eastleigh district. At least six are dead and scores injured. Al Shabaab are suspected. In the days following the explosion police arrest over 650 possible suspects.

A prominent hard-line Muslim cleric known as ""Makaburi"" is shot dead by unidentified assailants as he left a court hearing. Al Shabaab, of whom Makaburi is in league, stated that Kenyan security forces were behind the killing.

Two loud explosions were heard during the night-time hours at Dadaab Refugee Camp airstrip. It is believed that an al Shabaab affiliated camp militia was targeting security forces near the airstrip with grenades. The third grenade was thrown, but it failed to detonate. No reported injury or death.

Police clash with rioting Muslim youth following Friday prayers. The cause of the riot is believed to be related to the killing of a cleric earlier in the week. The youth threw stones, while the police implemented tear gas. The protesters were quickly dispersed. Casualties/injuries not reported. Police forces made a presence in Nairobi for fear of similar protests.

Arrests: A force of 6,100 police and soldiers are deployed to the heavily Somali populated Eastleigh neighbourhood to ""flush out illegal immigrants and suspected al Shabab members."" 3,000 arrests reported (Associated Press).
A vigilante mob attacks, lynches and kills a suspected thief. Date vague; occurred during the weekend.
Somali residents of Eastleigh, Nairobi protest against a police raid on a compatriots home, calling the raid ""harassment against the Somali community.""

A renown Somali peace seeker and businessman known as Shire Dhalabow was shot by two unidentified gunmen in north-eastern Kenyas border town of Mandera. The assailants who were boys of the ages between 14-17 years.
