On May 23rd, in Mombasa, protesters held a demonstration in Machokos along the Nairobi-Mombasa highway at Devki in Athi River, demanding compensation for land acquired for the dual carriageway project. [Size=300]

On May 23rd, residents of Mbaruk blocked the Nakuru-Nairobi highway placing a coffin of a person died in a car accident, to urge the government to addresses the rising cases of accidents in Gilgil sub-county. [Size=no report]

Around May 25th (exact date not reported), parents and former Nyanguru Secondary School students in Kisii stormed the school and locked the principal's office. Rioters protested over errors in their childreans' certificates, due to which they were unable to join college. [Size= no report]

On May 28th 2019, boda boda drivers in Lari blocked a street leading to Uplands Funeral Home to protest over the poor condition of the road. Two deep terraces were dug by protesters demanding the authorities repair the road. [size=no report]

30 May: One person died in Homa Bay area in a protest against operations of an investor who undertook cage fish farming along Lake Victoria. They said that he took all of their fishing area. [Size=No report]
04 June: Al Shabaab and Kenyan police forces clashed in Fino, Mandera county. One person from each group killed in the clash.
07 June: Unidentified armed men killed Homa Bay CEC executive, Dony Opar for unknown reason.

On Jun 8th, in a security operation, police officers allegedly invaded Kanuni Ward and torched nine house, goats and valuable property. Police dismissed claims saying only one makeshift was torched during operation to flash out criminals.

Around Jun 13th, an MCA raided Gesusu Sub-County Hospital In Kisii and kicked out hospital staffers and patients. During the raid, patients were forcefully discharged and business disrupted for hours. The MCA claimed doing this to ensure the provision of quality services in his ward, as five patients had died at the hospital in the previous month owing to negligence by the health officers.
13 June: Unidentified armed men killed a three years old girl and injured 7 others in Isiolo sub-county.
13 June: Unidentified armed men killed a civilian in Turkana. The victim, an old woman, was with a group of other women when she shot dead by armed men.
On Jun 14th 2019, in Quri area of Garba Tula, Borana and Somalis clashed. Five people, among which a young girl, were killed. Several were injured.
14 June: A police officer was shot dead at his home in Kitengela town, Kajiado county. His wife was also shot but survived.
On Jun 15th 2019, in Wajir, a police vehicle was hit by an IED. Officers were injured. No fatalities reported.
15 June: Several police officers feared dead after their vehicle ran over an IED planted by Al Shabaab in Wajir county. Fatalities coded as 3

On Jun 17th 2019, parents of Makuka Primary school students barricaded the entrance of the school to prevent the resumption of classes the following week, after half term. Protesters call for the removal of the headteacher, accused of mismanaging the institute. [size=no report]

On June 18th, Luruk residents barricaded the Marigat-Chemolingot in protest over frequent bandit attacks, occurring since the government withdrew guns from the National Police Reservists (NPR) a week before. Protesters also demanded their 200 goats stolen by bandits at Kagir in Baringo North. [Size= 300]
19 June: Mini-bus drivers protested against the police harassment in Dandora. [Size= no report]
20 June: Al Shabaab militants attacked a police camp in Garissa. 3 Al Shabaab militants were killed in the fight
On June 20th, in Nairobi, an anti-gay protest was held by the Catholic Justice and Peace Commission and the Kenya Christian Professional Forum. [Size=no report]

On Jun 20th 2019, residents of Bula Salama village in Tana River county (coded as Galole with GP2) marched to protest the construction of the county assembly speaker's official residence. [size=no report]
On June 22nd 2019, tea farmers gathered at Micimikuru facorty in Amugaa, demanding that a satellite factory be built. [size=5000]
On 23 June 2019, suspected Al-Shabaab militants abducted three elders in Fino (Lafey, Mandera).

27 June: A protest led by Nairobi Governor, Mike Sonko (of the Jubilee party) was held in Machakos against Governor Alfred Mutua, machakos county Governor for intimidating and harassing small scale traders in Machakos county. [Size=no report]

column9: KRC: Kenya Red Cross; Health Workers (Kenya)
column17: On Jun 27th 2019, in Kainuk a Kenya Red Cross driver was ambushed and shot by an unidentified armed group. No fatalities reported.

On Jun 27th 2019, boda boda drivers held a violent demonstration, blocking the Kakamega - Kisumu road, in Shinyalu to protest the death of one of them who died in police custody. The man was arrested because his motorbike allegedly hit and killed a person. The area was described as a ""battlefield"" between demonstrators and the police. [size=no report]
02 July: Unidentified armed group killed one person and stole 150 cows in Sololo, Marsabit County.
On Jul 3rd 2019, residents of Gede protested over the two-week-delay in restoring power after a blackout in the village. [size=no report]

Around Jul 4th 2019 (exact date not reported) a herder in Sangailu was burnt with a hot object by a soldier. A video, which got frequent airplay on the internet, shows a senior military officer calming down residents, promising to take the victim for treatment.
Around Jul 4th 2019, residents of Sangailu protested after a man was allegedly burnt by military officers. [Size=no report]

On Jul 6th, in Isiolo, Police Forces allegedly beat a man to death. It supposedly happened following a scuffle when they tried to arrest him following accusations he had threatened to kill a person. Police deny the fact occurred.
On Jul 7th 2019, residents and boda boda drivers of Kaksingir lynched a man accused of stealing a motorcycle. 1 fatality. [size=no report]
On Jul 9th, civil servants in Laikipia held a peaceful demonstration over their delayed June salaries. [size=no report]

On Jul 9th, in Narok, public transport drivers (matatu drivers) who operate using the Toyota Probox cars blocked the Narok -Mau- Nakuru road at Oloserian junction interrupting traffic flow for hours over alleged police harassment. Drivers accused police of erecting illegal roadblocks along the road and using it to harass the probox drivers into parting with bribes. [Size=no report]
On July 10th, National Youth Service trainees lamented over lack of school fees, accommodation and food at the Riat Institute of Advanced Technology in Kisumu. [Size=400]
On Jul 10th 2019, Bungoma residents protested over the poor condition of the Pamus-Ndengelwa Road, by blocking the traffic and planting banana stems. [size=no report]
10 July : Unidentified armed group attacked Ethiopian refugees in Kakuma refugees camp in Kenya. One killed in the attack and others wounded

On Jul 10th 2019, in Embu village, boda boda and taxi drivers protested over a large and suspicious donation to a church from an MCA. Protesters also accused their representative of donating money to church instead of improving the living standards of the community. [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Border Patrol Unit
column17: 15 July: Two border patrol police were injured by an IED planted by Al Shabaab in Kiunga- Somalia road.

column8: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Border Patrol Unit
column17: 15 July: Three suspected Al Shabaab militants were killed in Lamu by Kenya border patrol police soon after the detonated IED injured two officers in Kiunga -Somalia road.

Around Jul 19th 2019 (exact date not reported), in Magena, residents held a violent protest against the death of a meat dealer, killed on the same day, in front of a police station. Rioters accused officers of having ignored the man's distress call while he was being killed. Protesters burned tyres and vandalized the local police station. Police fired teargas to disperse the crowd. A student was killed during the riots. [size=no report]
On Jul 23rd 2019, meat sellers protested against an eviction order by City Hall. [size=no report]
On Jul 23rd 2019, a protest was held in Isiolo town by relatives and friends of the man beaten to death by police two weeks before. [size=no report]
On Jul 23rd, residents of Muhoroni held a demonstration to demand 4,000 acres of their land that had been taken by a sugar company a few years after Independence. [size=thousands]
Around Jul 24th 2019 (no exact date reported) residents of Gatundu protested against the lack of police investigation into the killing of a villager by suspected drug peddlers. [size=no report]
27 July: One Kenyan airport police was killed in the clash with a group of armed men that approached them pretending to be GSU, General Service Unit police.

On Jul 20th 2019, Limuru residents tried to lynch a man suspected of being a serial sodomiser. His house was burnt by the mob. Police intervened to stop the crowd. No fatalities reported.[size=no report]

On Jul 29th, nurses held a peaceful procession in Kisumu demanding justice for the death of their colleague, the KNUN official Ferdinand Ongeri, who was found dead in Kimondi Forest in Nandi county. [Size=no report]
02 Aug: Residents of Garissa barricaded the road by setting fires on the road demonstrating against the death of the man in the military camp by a member of Kenyan military forces. [size=no report]

On Aug 2nd 2019, residents rioted in Garissa protesting over the killing of a man who entered a military camp, on the same day. Tyres were burnt, traffic disrupted and rioters clashed with police. [size=no report]
On Aug 4th 2019, police officers dismantelled an Al Shabaab camp in Wakabheley, 25km inside Boni forest, in Lamu County (coded as Kiunga with GP2 for unfound Wakabheley). No fatalities reported.
On Aug 4th 2019, Loborot residents (location coded as Kanankemer with GP2, for unfound Loborot) protested against evictions and land grabbing cases in the area. [size=hundreds]

On Aug 6th 2019, in Nuandarua, parents of Gikingi Primary School pupils rioted against the ""indiscriminate cutting down of trees"" by the school. Parents had agreed with cutting only 5 trees, but more than 200 trees were cut. [size=no report]

On Sept 9th 2019, residents of the Karima ward in Nyeri protested over garbage dumping at the Gikeu dumpsite. Residents reported that they have been experiencing respiratory problems due to the amount of garbage disposed of at the site. [size=no report]

Around Aug 1st 2019 (exact date not reported), Naaro residents blocked the footpath through which a corpse was being ferried by mourners. Protesters held the family of the deceased responsible for destroing their crops when, a few days before, they cut them with machetes to create more space for the coffin to pass. In retaliation, residents blocked the road. Police forces intervened to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]
On Aug 8th 2019, boda boda drivers and members of Kapsoit Ward FC blocked the traffic in Kericho town to demand the resignation of of Kapsoit MCA Paul Chirchir Tarimbo. [size=100]
On Aug 14th, at least 250 families were evicted from Eldoret. The police used teargas to force out tenants who refused to move out of their houses.

On Aug 15th, Kangemi residents stormed a census enumerators training centre to protest against alleged flawed hiring of outsiders. Police lobbed tear gas canisters to disperse the crowd. [Size=no report]

In August (exact date not reported), after the Land Ministry nullified over 1,274 title deeds in advance of the evictions, officials evicting Mau Forest settlers (location coded as Mau Narok with GP2) reportedly beat people, torched homes, and destroyed crops, leaving thousands of people homeless.

16 Aug. Tour operators held a demonstration following the death of their colleague in a police station in Ndaragwa. Their colleague collapsed and died in the police station after being arrested for a traffic violation. [Size=no report]

On Aug 16th, tour drivers on Friday paralysed businesses along the Nyeri-Nyahururu road in protest against the death of their colleague at Ndaragwa police station (location coded as Ndaragwa with GP2). The driver allegedly collapsed and died at the police station moments after he was arrested, allegedly, for speeding. [Size=50]
On or before Aug 18th, landowners in Naikara staged a protest over the subdivision of a 10.000-acre ranch in Narok. The protesters alleged that the list of beneficiaries was manipulated. [Size=500]
On Aug 18th 2019, residents of Nyamembe (coded as Kuria East for unfound Nyamembe) were assaulted over missing cattle. No fatalities reported.
22 August: Mombasa residents held demonstration against the county judge who has reportedly been protecting drug lords in the county. [Size=No report]

On Aug 22nd, protesters gathered outside a meeting of top judges, lawyers and judicial officers focussed on handling drug-related cases, claiming judges are corrupt and have interests in protecting drug lords. [Size=dozens]
22 August: Al Shabaab militants attacked Kenyan security forces in Mandera. Two Kenyan police killed in the attack.
25 Aug. Five people were killed in an attack carried out by suspected militias from Ethiopia in Forole, Marsabit County, Kenya. They also took unknown number of their cows.

25 Aug. Unidentified armed men from Ethiopia attacked the herders in Sabareh, Marsabit County, Kenya. Five herders killed in the attack. The suspected militias took unknown number of their cows and crossed the border into Ethiopia.

On 25 August 2019, a land rights activist was abducted and killed by unknown persons from Muthini village near Kabati (Kandara, Murang'a). Two days later her body was discovered. The activist was investigating abuses meted out to squatters living on parcels of land claimed by some tycoons.
On Aug 25th 2019, in Safarisi, herders and farmers clashed over pasture. Farmers accused the herders (mostly from Tana River and Garissa counties) of grazing animals on their farms. A man was killed.

Around Sept 1st 2019 (date not reported) Al Shabaab militants attached Yumbis, at the border with Somalia. The militants burnt the station and a vehicle ferrying medicine. No casualties were reported.

On Sept 2nd, after a first eviction phase which took place in July 2018, Kenyan Government started a second phase of evictions, tageting at least 60 families. Exact coordinates not reported, location coded as Narok with GP2.

On Sept 3rd 2019, in Athi River (also known as Mavoko) parents of of Eagles Emulators Academy held a deonstration to protest the closure of the school with no official communication from the ministry. Protesters demanded its immediate reopening. [size=no report]
On Sept 6th, workers protested over 6-month delayed salaries at a Pipes-producing company in Limuru. [Size=no report]

On September 8th, pastoralists attacked civilians at unspecified locations in Kitui East and West constituencies (Kitui county), killing 2. Two events coded at Malalani and Kakeani (at geoprec2), with 1 fatality each.

On September 8, pastoralists attacked civilians at unspecified locations in Kitui East and West constituencies (Kitui county), killing 2. Two events coded at Malalani and Kakeani (at geoprec2), with 1 fatality each.
On Sept 9th, striking health workers staged a demonstration outside Governor Charity Ngilu's office in Kitui, demanding the payment of July and August salaries. [Szie=no report]

column7: KUDHEIHA: Kenya Union of Domestic, Hotels, Educational Institutions, Hospital and Allied Workers; Health Workers (Kenya); Labour Group (Kenya)
column17: On Sept 9th, Kenya Union of Domestic, Hotels, Educational Institutions, Hospital and Allied Workers (KUDHEIHA) members staged a protest in Nairobi, over the failure to implement a State resolution that upgraded the hospital's parastatal status. [Size=no report]
09 Sep. Muranga residents held demonstration against the arrest of Ndindi Nyoro, member of a parliament. [size=no report]
09 Sep. A police shot and killed a mutatu driver after he refused to comply with his order to stop
09 Sep. Kangaru residents held demonstration after a police shot killed a mutatu driver saying that the driver was innocent. [size=no report]
On Sep 9th 2019, Muranga residents held violent demonstration against the arrest of Ndindi Nyoro, member of a parliament. [size=no report]
09 Sep. Multimedia students held demonstration after a student was hit by a bus last week. [size=no report]

On or before Sept 10th, camel herders attacked 3 men in Mutha. 1 Man was killed and other 2 suffered injuries. This action allegedly occurred as a consequence of the attack of Sept 7th in Ingo village (Isiolo).
On Sept 10th, the body of a dead soldier was found by residents of Mtongwe (Mombasa neighborhood), where he was believed to be based. No further information is available.
10 Sep. Suspected armed men from Somalia beheaded a man in Kitui county after sporadic pasture conflicts
12 Sep. Gatundu County residents held demonstration against the rising the insecurity in the area. [size=no report]
On September 10, 2019, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a KDF convoy near Elwak (Mandera county), killing at least 5 soldiers.
On or around Sept 12th, parents of Mathemba Secondary School students gathered to demand justice for their children who were beaten by police during a strike. [Size=no report]
On or around Sept 12th, police officers stormed the Mathemba Secondary School and beat up students during a planned strike. About 10 students were injured.
12 Sep. 4 killed by armed men in Tana Selta, Tana River County (no coordinates available for Tana delta)
12 Sep. Kigumo town residents held demonstration against Kirinyaga Governor for accusing members of County Assembly (MCA). [size=no report]

On Sept 12th 2019, in Ngeya village (coded as Mai Mahiu with GP2 for unfound Ngeya), following the death of a schoolchild hit by a car, the same day, residents protested over the frequency of car accidents in the area. [size=no report]
On Sept 13th, Kenya Defence Forces soldiers beat up residents of Mtongwe (Mombasa neighborhood) to revenge the killing of a colleague occurred on Sept 10th.
15 Sep. A member of Anti-Stock Theft Unit police shot three civilians and left them wounded in Trans mara district.The motive of shooting is unknown. The police was later arrested.

On Sept 16th, in Voi, 2 herders were killed and other 3 injured in suspected retiliatory attacks The two herdsmen were suspected to have killed a boda boda driver, who was later found dumped in a forest.

On Sept 17th 2019, in Garba Tula, Borana and Somalis clashed. Armed Borana allegedly descended on their Somali counterparts, killing the three herders. In a retaliatory attack, a Borana elder was killed and five others were injured.
On Sept 17th 2019, in Isiolo South, four unarmed herdsmen were killed by an unknown armed militia. The killing might be due to boundary disputes or to resources.

18 Sep. Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology students held demonstration regarding the deadline required for paying the fees. Students stoned some vehicles in the campus while police intervened and arrested some demonstrators. [Size=no report]

18 Sep. Technical University of Mombasa students held a demonstration over high amount of fees. They burnt tyres and barricaded Mombasa-Malindi highway in Buxton before they were repulsed by the police.Many students were arrested. [Size= no report]

On Sept 18th, Masinde Muliro University students rioted to protest the university's memo stating that no learner will be allowed to sit exams without clearing their fee arrears. Rioters threw stones at the police and blocked traffic. As a consequence, the University was indefinitely closed. [Size=no report]
On Sept 18th 2019, Mombasa demonstrators protested against the assault of a human rights activist by an Immigration police officer the day before. [size=no report]
On Sept 20th, in Mkocheni village (coded as Taveta with precision2), a fight between farmers and herders over access to a water source arose, leaving serious injuries.

Around Sept 20th 2019 (exact date nort reported), a man was shot dead at Ntangilia (coded as Miathene, with GP2) allegedly by Turkana herders who are said to have brought their camels to Meru for pasture.

Around Sept 21st 2019, Hulugho villagers were reportedly attacked by the military, who descended on their village at midnight and indiscriminately opened fire. According to pictures circulating on the following days, one man was shot in the head.

Around Spet 21st 2019 (exact date not reported), during ODM rally in Malindi, fights erupted between ODM supporters and supporters of the independent candidate Abdulrahman Omar Mohamed. Police intervened to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

23 Sep. Mombasa residents held demonstration against the plan by the state to build a dry port in Naivasha. Businessmen, long-distance truck drivers, Container Freight Station workers, clearing and forwarding agents, clerks and a section of port workers took part in the demonstration. They promised every day demonstration until the government responds to their request. [size=no report]

On Sept 23rd, flower farm and Kengen company workers blocked the Moi South Lake Road in Naivasha demanding for its rehabilitation by the national government. Rioters lit bonfires and used boulders to block the road. Police used tear gas to disperse the crowd. [Size= no report]
On Sept 23rd 2019, residents of Ithamare held a demonstration against the decision of a Meru court to close the Mbaarua Primary School, as it did not meet the required standards. [size=no report]
On September 23, unidentified attackers killed four pastoralists and stole livestock at Baragoi (Samburu county).
24 Sep. Parents of Ndakaini mixed day secondary school in Gatanga, Muranga county held demonstration after the students were sent home over unpaid bread fees. [size=no report]

column7: Awlyahan Ethnic Militia (Kenya); Auliyan Clan Group (Kenya)
column9: Abduwak Ethnic Group (Kenya); Auliyan Clan Group (Kenya)
column17: On 25 November 2019, sources reported that ""two months ago"" ethnic militiamen killed two citizens in Garissa county amid tensions between the Adbuwak and Awlyahan groups in the area.
25 Sep. Mutatu drivers held demonstration in Kwale against private cars carrying passengers. [Size=no report]
On Sept 25th 2019, in Naivasha, residents and workers protested, demanding the reabilitation of the Moi South Lake Road. Police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

Between 25th and 26th of Sep. two people killed in the clash between Maasai's two clans. The two clans, Siria and Uasin Gishu are fighting over a two-acre parcel of land located at the border in Trans Mara District. One source reported the event to be on the 25th while the other source reported it to be on the 26th.

On Sept 27th, a group of parents camped outside a Kibera court to demand the release of the owner of the Precious Talent Academy. A few days before, a part of the schook collapsed killing eight children. Held responsible for the poor conditions of the structure, the owner was arrested. Parents, however, defended him claiming he was only a teacher, not the architect of the structure and called for his release. [Size= no report]

On Aug 28th, in the village of Kosovo, at the border of Naivasha and Narok counties (coded as Naivasha with GP2 for unfound Kosovo), a police officer was killed by locals. After 2,000 acres were sold to some pastoralists by ADC, a group locals claimed that the land belonged to their ancestors. While a manager of the the Agricultural Development Corporation, his staff and the police officer were visiting the land, they were attacked by an unknown armed group of around 50 youth who killed a police officer by a poisoned arrow. A tractor belonging to ADC was burnt by the attackers.

On Oct 1st 2019, demonstrators blocked the Eldoret-Kitale road to protest the death of a college student, allegedly killed by her ex-boyfriend. Police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]
01 Oct. 7 people killed in the attack on Banisaa Village that was carried out by Degodia clan militia.
01 Oct. 3 Suspected Alshabaab militants killed by Kenyan police in Likoni. The suspects were on the mission to carry out terrorist attack according to the report

01 Oct. Mombasa residents held demonstration for the second time against Government's directive to have all containers ferried to Nairobi's Inland Container Deport moved through the Standard Gauge Railway. [size=no report]

On 6 October 2019, in Mau forest (no exact location reported, location coded as Mau Narok with GP2) a Kenya Forest Service officer on patrol was shot with an arrow by some forest settlers facing eviction, who had been complaining over police harassment, destruction of property, and the closure of roads leading to their former homes. No reported fatalities.

On Oct 7th, human rights activists and truckers demonstrated against a suspended government directive to have all imported cargo transported to the hinterland exclusively via the Standard Gauge Railway and not via trucks. Police officers fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. [Size=no report]
On Oct 7th 2019, a priest was kidnapped, murdered and buried in a shallow grave in Embu County by unknown men. His body was found a week after. The motives of the killing are unclear.
On 7 October 2019, a mob in Wanalo village of Hamisi, Vihiga county, reportedly killed a man who had allegedly confessed to having defiled a child on the same day. [size=no report]

On Oct 7th, Kenyatta University students engaged in a violent demonstration against the suspension of students and student leaders on petty basis, the sacking of more than 700 casual workers without notice and the increment of graduation fee. Police forces intervened to disperse the crowd. [Size=no report]

On Oct 8th, Kenyatta University students engaged in a violent demonstration against the suspension of students and student leaders on petty basis, the sacking of more than 700 casual workers without noticethe and the increment of graduation fee. Police forces intervened to disperse the crowd. [Size=no report]

On Oct 8th 2019, Migori MCAs protested disrupting operations at county government offices, demanding the release of Sh100 million ward bursary funds, which had been allocated in March. Protesters abducted Education executive from his office and marched him to other offices as they trailed his Finance counterpart. [Size=50]

On Oct 8th, in Karen, a group of young people rioted outside Deputy President William Ruto's official residence after they were reportedly denied entry to a meeting he was having with some members of the Abagusii community. Police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. [Size=100]
On Oct 9th, four youths were attacked and injured allegedly by the police in Siakago. Circumstances are not clear.
On Oct 9th, young people in Nairobi marched to protest over unemployment. [Size=no reports]
On Oct 9th, refugees in Nairobi County marched to demand compensation for cases of violence after 2007 elections. [Size=no report]

On Oct 11th, Moi University students demonstrated against alleged poor management of the university. The demonstration, which led to destruction of property, harassment and injury of some University officer, resulted in the decision of the Administration to close the main campus. [Size=no report]

On 12 October 2019, 10 police officers from Harhar GSU Camp in Garissa County, on patrol along the Damajale Harehare road near the Kenya-Somalia border, died as their vehicle ran through an explosive device. Police forces later identified the group leader that planted the device as an Al Shabaab militant who joined the group in 2012.

On Oct 13th 2019, in Lanyiru, at the Meru-Isiolo border, in a response to an attack occurred the same day in Tigania East, Meru pastoralists killed a man believed to be one of the perpetrators of the attack.

On Oct 14th 2019, in Wangwachi (coded as Sipili with GP2, for unfound Wangwachi) unknown armed men shot and wounded two National Police Reservists, who were transported to Sipili Hospital. No fatalities reported.
On Oct 14th 2019, Baringo health workers marched in Kabarnet to protest over the nonpayment of salaries for 5 months. [Size=no report]
On Sept 15th 2019, during an Isiolo-Garissa border attack, three herdsmen were killed and 100 camels stolen by unidentified individuals in Garba Tula.
On Oct 15th 2019, 10 unknown men ambushed and shot a security ranger, who was patrolling Laikipia Nature and Conservancy ranch with two colleagues. After and exchange of fire, one person died.

On Oct 16th 2019, Green Peace Africa activists and local farmers staged a demonstration at the Makueni Agricultural Training Centre, Kwa Kathoka, where Celebrations for the World Food Day were being held. Protesters demanded the ban of chemical ingredients harmful to the environment, found in some pesticides. [size=no report]
On Oct 16th 2019, a group of women in Likuyani demonstrated against increased incidents of rape and other sexual assaults in the area. [Size=no report]

On Oct 16th 2019, a group demonstrated throwing bloody pigs' heads inside the Delta Hotel in Nairobi, demanding the resignation of its owner, Kiambu Governor Waititu, accused of abuse of office charges. Riot police intervened, firing tear gas to disperse the crowd. [Size=no report]
On Oct 17th 2019, residents of Kisii, protested in front of the immigration Department over delayed travel documents. [size=no report]

On Oct 19th 2019, around 30 Kariokor residents were evicted by county askaris over a claim that the illegal settlement had been built on the land of commonwealth war cemetry. Houses, built of iron sheets and timber, were demolished by bulldozers.

On Oct 20th 2019, in Eldama Ravine town, Baringo county askaris beat and abducted a disabled person who was asking to address the public in order to denounce the government's failure to remit funds for disabled for a long time. The man was injured.
On Oct 22nd 2019, in Mombasa, cargo truck drivers protested a government directive to have importers move all containers headed to Nairobi by the Standard Gauge Railway (SGR). [size= no report]
On Oct 22nd 2019, census officials protested in Kakamega over the three-month delay in their payment. [size=no report]
On Oct 22nd 2019, census officials protested in Eldoret over the three-month delay in their payment. [size=no report]

column7: Ogiek Ethnic Group (Kenya); Ndorobo Ethnic Group (Kenya)
column17: On Oct 22nd 2019, members of the Ogiek and Ndorobo communities living around Chepkitale Forest in Mount Elgon protested over the decision to evict them from the area and relocate them from Chepkitale to Chepyuk. [size=no report]
On Oct 23rd 2019, in Ol Kalou, meat sellers protested the closure (since July) of the public slaughterhouse, which forced them to use a private abbattoir 4km from Ol Kalou. [size=no report]
On Oct 23th 2019, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a matatu vehicle in Mandera. The driver managed to speed up avoiding bullets hitting passengers.
On Oct 24th 2019, a man suspected of kidnapping a child was killed by police at Homa Bay.

Around Oct 26th 2019 (exact date not reported) clashes took place in Trans Mara district between Siria and Ilwuasi Ngishu clan militias. 6 people were injured, including one officer deployed to sepatate the clans.

On Oct 26th 2019, residents of Njiru held a violent demonstration over an eviciton notice received by a private developer. The road was blocked with stones and burning tyres. Protesters clashed with police officers, who fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]

On Oct 27th 2019, a mob threw stones at Mudavadi, the leader of the Amani National Congress (ANC), who was holding a campaign rally at the Kamukunji grounds in Nairobi. Police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. No fatalities reported. [size=no report]

Around Oct 27th 2019 (exact date not reported), two Siria and Ruasi Ngishu clans clashed at the Enoororet-Enoorsoen border in Trans Mara district. 31 people were shot with arrows. No fatalities reported.

On Oct 27th 2019, residents of Njiru held a violent demonstration over an eviciton notice received by a private developer. The road was blocked with stones and burning tyres. Protesters clashed with police officers, who fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]
On Oct 28th 2019, residents of Kibundani staged a peaceful protest over the number of killings and disappearance of youths in the area. [size=no report]

On Oct 28th 2019, residents and drivers staged a demonstration over the bad condition of the Kikuyu-Dagoretti road, which was damaged by heavy rain. Traffic was blocked during the rush hour. Police intervened.

On October 29, gunmen ambushed a convoy of vehicles carrying mirra (khat) into Baragoi (Samburu county, coordinates used at prec2). The attackers killed one driver and wounded four others. The attackers released the convoy after looting from it, telling the survivors they were not the inteded target.
On Oct 29th 2019, an Al Shabaab militia attacked a police station in Dadaj-Bula. The number of fatalities or injuries is not known.
Around Oct 30th 2019 (exact date not reported) traders protested in Engineer, over the condition of the market, worsened by heavy rains. Protesters called for Government assistance. [size=no report]
On Oct 30th 2019, Embu University Students staged a protest over proposed fees. The road in front of the school was blocked. Police fired tear gas to disperse the crowd. [size=no report]
On October 31, 2019, a lynch mob killed a murder suspect in Kithimu (Embu county). [size=no report]
On Nov 1st 2019, residents of Tsunza protested, claiming they were owed compensation for donating their land for construction of the Dongo highway. [size=no report]
On Mar 11th 2019, NHC project workers in Nygeri gathered at the site to protest over delayed payments and to demand improved working conditions. [size=250]

On or around November 5, 2019, a mob formed in Kithimu (Embu county), and set alight a number of dwellings that belonged to several murder suspects, who had been released from police custody. [size=no report]

On November 5, 2019, an unidentified armed group attacked Jaldesa (Marsabit county), killing at least 7, including 2 police who were engaged in a firefight with the attackers. The attack is said to be retaliatory in nature, though there is no further information.

On November 5, an unidentified armed group (described as ""bandits"" it some sources) ambushed a vehicle in Kukuto area of Marsabit county (coordinates for Jaldesa used at prec2), killing at least three.

On November 5, 2019, supporters of Nairobi Governor Mike Sonko demonstrated outside of the Integrity Centre (in Kilimani, Nairobi), after he was summoned due to irregularities with paperwork he submitted when running for office. Police dispersed his supporters with tear gas. [size=hundreds]

On 5 November 2019, attackers reportedly raided Atirir and Chepkilowon villages in Tirioko ward of Tiaty, Baringo county, killing two herders and driving away with 4,000 goats, 300 cows and 70 camels belonging to six families. Local sources claims that Turkana herders carried out the attack and were armed with AK-47 rifles - but it's unclear if these reports are substantiated.

On November 6, 2019, the governments of Kenya and Uganda signed a Memorandum of Understanding on the disputed Mingingo Islands, in which the population of both nations are able to fish in the area. The MoU does not resolve the issue of ownership. The islands have been at the centre of a number of violent incidents, usually instigated by Ugandan security forces.

On November 7, 2019, ODM supporters beat a Jubilee MP (Didimus Barasa) as he was campaigning in Kibra, during a heated by-election, and threw stones at a former senator from Kakamega, Boni Khalwale. Video of the attack on the MP went viral. [size=small]

On November 7, 2019, a mob attacked three individuals after they were discovered to be bribing voters in the disputed Kibra by-election (coordinates for Kiberia, Nairobi, used), injuring one, and turning them over to the police. [size=no report]

On or before November 8, 2019, police clashed with cattle raiders at an unspecified location on the Meru side of the Meru-Isiolo border (coordinates for Ndumuru, Meru county, used at prec2). Reports suggest that gunfire was involved, though police have denied this.

On 10 November 2019, residents of Lukume village in Malava, Kakamega county, reportedly beat up a man who had just killed his mother while he was under the influence of drugs. The man was taken to the hospital. [size=no report]

On November 11, 2019, students from Jomo Kenyatta University (Kiambu county) demonstrated against insecurity in the area around the university, and blocked traffic on the nearby highway (note: the sources do not mention how traffic was blocked; demonstrators accordingly coded as protesters). Police beat protesters, with footage emerging of five police officers severely beating a student whilst he was on the ground. Four police officers have been suspended. [size=large]

On November 11, 2019, two factions of the Jubilee Coalition clashed in the county assembly of Nairobi, as part of a dispute over the leadership of the assembly. Police broke up the scuffling groups, and fired tear gas into the assembly. [size=no report]
On November 12, 2019, students protested at the central police office at Juja (Kiambu county), following a violent suppression of a student demonstration the previous day. [size=no report]

On November 13, 2019, students demonstrated in Mombasa against rising insecurity in the area, and clashed with a group of youths in the process. Several students were injured. Police fired into the air to disperse the demonstrators. [size=no report]

column8: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
column17: On November 13, 2019, anti-abortion protesters gathered at the KICC in central Nairobi, before being dispersed by police from the GSU. [size=no report]

On 13 November 2019, over 300 demonstrators reportedly burned tyres in front of Suswa Trading Centre on the Narok-Mai Mahiu road at the crossing of Kajiado, Narok and Naruku counties, demanding compensation for farm land of the Kedong ranch that will be partially converted into a dry port (the Inland Container Depot in Naivasha). Police forces reportedly intervened to open the road. [size=300]

On November 13, 2019, striking health workers demonstrated in Voi (Taita Taveta county), calling for 60m KSH of salary arrears to be paid, and for adquate provisioning of medical supplies. [size=dozens]

On November 15, 2019, a mob of local residents and boda boda riders attacked private security guards who had been hired to protect a hearse at the funeral of a murdered businessman in Bumala (Busia county), in a case of mistaken identity. Six of the guards were killed by the mob. [size=no report]

On November 16, 2019, coffee farmers protested at a meeting of the coffee task forces in Kutus town (Kirinyaga county), after being excluded from participation in the meeting. The meeting was then cancelled. [size=no report]
On November 20, 2019, a KDF soldier shot and killed a boda boda driver outside the naval base in Mtongwe (Mombassa county). The circumstances surronding the killing are disputed.

On November 21, 2019, demonstrators marched in Lodwar (Turkana county), calling for the closure of a slaughterhouse in the area, which they say has decimated the number of donkeys in the area. [size=no report]

On 23 November 2019, Imenti youths reportedly blocked the Nkabune-Kathurine road that connects several schools in Nkabune, Meru county, with trees, to denounce the conditions of the impractical road. [size=no report].

On the night of 23 to 24 November 2019, a house was set on fire in Nyunzu market a few kilometres away from Wote in Makueni county, killing its four innocupants (an elder woman, her daughter and her two grand daughters) in the early morning of 24 November. A male family member embroiled in a land dispute with the women was arrested the next day.

On 24 November 2019, groups of armed men with machetes reportedly attacked citizens and injured 10 of them in the constituencies of Nyali and Kisauni, Mombasa, as they were on their way to Kongowea market. Most of the victims were businessmen. 11 people were later arrested, with some sources reporting that they belonged to a gang called '86 Battalion' or to the Wakali Kwanza gang.

On 24 November 2019, groups of armed men with machetes reportedly attacked citizens and injured 10 of them in the constituencies of Nyali and Kisauni, Mombasa, as they were on their way to Kongowea market. Most of the victims were businessmen. 11 people were later arrested, with some sources reporting that they belonged to a gang called '86 Battalion' or to the Wakali Kwanza gang.

column7: Auliyan Ethnic Militia (Kenya); Abduwak Ethnic Militia (Kenya)
column9: Farmers (Kenya); Abduwak Ethnic Group (Kenya); Auliyan Ethnic Militia (Kenya)
column17: On 25 November 2019, ethnic militiamen reportedly killed a local farmer in Raya area of Balambala sub-county, Garissa county, amid tensions between the Adbuwak and Awlyahan groups in the area.

On 26 November 2019, two individuals suspected of being part of a gang were lynched by the population in Ndumberi and Tinganga areas of Kiambu county; fatalities spread across two locations. [size=no report].

On 26 November 2019, two individuals suspected of being part of a gang were lynched by the population in Ndumberi and Tinganga areas of Kiambu county; fatalities spread across two locations. [size=no report].

On 3 December 2019, it was reported that ""last week"" a boy was killed in Tiaty subcounty, Baringo county, by attackers who drove away with 50 camels. Attacks happens in context of tension between Turkana and Pokot pastoralist militias, but is is unclear to what extent killing relates to these tensions.

On 29 November 2019, residents of Jasko in Mavoko, Machakos county, were reportedly attacked by unidentified men who demolished several houses and injured residents, one of whom was allegedly beaten up with crude weapons. Two individuals were later arrested. Jasko residents decry increased attacks over land disputes, accusing ""cartels"" to be trying to force them out of the area.

On 1 December 2019, after the local bishop kicked a youth belonging to a group of worshippers that had been barred from the church two years ago following their call for recognition of the Coast Region Conference, the worshippers forced their way into the Methodist church of Kilifi, requiring the intervention of police forces. [size=no report]

On 1 December 2019, policemen reportedly patrolled through the streets of Mararani in Lamu East, Lamu county, and beat up residents, arresting 10 of them, after locals had earlier beaten up two policemen after alleged harassment on the citizens.

On 1 December 2019, residents of Mararani in Lamu East, Lamu county, reportedly beat up two policemen, tied them up and brought them to the police station after they started to harass citizens while under the influence of alcohol. They allegedly beat up several residents and stole a phone. [size=no report]

On 2 December 2019, Maseno University in Kisumu county was indefinitely closed following demonstrations of students that spread across 1-2 December, during which students allegedly pelted motorists with stones. The demonstrations denounced the insecurity at the campus after the rape of two students. [size=no report]

On 2 December 2019, residents of Fedha and Nyayo estates in Embakasi area of Nairobi reportedly held a demonstration to denounce the poor road conditions in the area, blocking roads with stones and burning tires. Police forces intervened with teargas to disperse the demonstrators. Event coded at Embakasi area, located between Fedha and Nyayo estates. [size=no report]
On 2 December 2019, a mob reportedly ambushed and killed a suspected member of the Wakali Kwanza gang as he was robbing a house in Mrima area of Likoni, Mombasa county. [size=no report]

On 2 December 2019, Maseno University in Kisumu county was indefinitely closed following demonstrations of students that spread across 1-2 December, during which students allegedly pelted motorists with stones. The demonstrations denounced the insecurity at the campus after the rape of two students. [size=no report]

On 3 December 2019, Nairobi residents reportedly beat up two men to death in Temple Road of Nairobi, in City Square neighbourhood, after they allegedly conned a woman of her money during street gambling. [size=no report]

column7: Turkana Ethnic Militia (Kenya); Pokot Ethnic Militia (Kenya)
column9: Women (Kenya); Turkana Ethnic Group (Kenya); Pokot Ethnic Group (Kenya)
column17: On 3 December 2019, three women were reported killed and another one injured in an attack on Kapau area near Kapedo in Tiaty, Baringo county. Although the attackers were not clearly identified, the source reported that the incident took place in the context of increased tensions in the area between Turkana and Pokot groups since August.

In the early hours of 4 December 2019, Al Shabaab militants reportedly attacked the city of Diiso in Fafi, Garissa county, with no report of fatalities nor injuries. While the organisation claimed to have taken control of the city, including its police station, Kenyan media sources only reported about police forces thwarting an attack on a Safaricom mast in the city, with militants only destroying a diesel generator before fleeing towards the Somali border.

On 4 December 2019, businessmen who import goods in the area of Mombasa reportedly held a protest to denounce being forced to use the Standard Gauge Railway instead of trucks, which are cheaper, to transport their goods. Although the source reported the event has a weekly incident, the last such event recorded by ACLED took place on 22 October 2019 (KEN7025). [size=no report]

On 5 December 2019, around 500 health workers who had recently been sacked by Vihiga county governor after alleged irrelugar hiring in May reportedly staged a protest to denounce the decision and demand unpaid salaries. [size=500]

On 4 December 2019, Egerton University in Njoro, Nakuru county, was indefinitely closed following demonstrations of students that caused significant damages, as they also engaged with police forces who responded with teargas and arrested two students. The demonstrations denounced a hike in fees and the university's decision not to let students sit for exams if they had not cleared their fees. [size=no report]

column9: Christian Group (Kenya); Police Forces of Kenya (2013-); Teachers (Kenya); Health Workers (Kenya)
column17: On 6 December 2019, Al Shabaab claimed responsibility for an attack on a bus bound for Mandera between Kotulo and Waragud areas of Tarbaj, Wajir county, which killed 11 Christian passengers after militants separated locals and non-locals (victims consist of 8 policemen, 2 teachers and a doctor) . The militants then fled to neighbouring Somalia as Kenyan forces deployed to the area, while the bus driver and a passanger were arrested.

On December 8 2019, members of the Kieleweke and Tanga Tanga groups clashed in Nyeri outside of a school where Deputy President William Ruto was going to be attending an event. Over 10 people were arrested.

On December 10 2019, refugees from Sudan and from South Sudan clashed in the Kakuma refugee camp, resulting in 5 deaths and at least 5 injuries. The fighting began after a football match. [size=no report]
On December 12 2019, two unidentified attackers wearing Islamic clothing for women hacked to death a Lamu chief and his assistant in their office in Mbwajumwali.
On December 12 2019, youth demonstrated violently in Busia after the Kenyan revenue service raided a shop to confiscate contraband cigarettes. No addition information was available. [size=no report]
On December 13 2019, railroad workers reportedly marched in Mai Mahiu over unpaid wages. No further information was available. [size=no report]
On December 14 2019, a mob killed a suspected criminal who was wielding a knife in Likoni. [size=no report]

On December 14 2019, a mob torched a public service vehicle near Bugar (Kapchemutwa, Keiyo North, Elegeyo-Marakwet). The vehicle had collided with a motorcycle in a road traffic accident, killing two people. [size=no report]
On December 15 2019, hundreds of members of 46 churches protested against the proliferation of bars in Kithirune (Central Imenti, Meru). [size=hundreds]
On December 16 2019, a mob chopped the foot off a man who had been stopped by farm guards for alleged theft in Antubeiga. The man later died in the hospital. [size=no report]
On December 16 2019, workers protested on the Makupa Causeway Road in Mombasa (Chaani, Mvita) over fears they would not be paid during the Christmas holiday. [size=no report]
Around December 16 2019, Al Shabaab claimed it killed 9 people in Harbul village near Garissa town.
On December 17 2019, three people were kidnapped by suspected Al Shabaab militants between Riba and Konton. One of the potential victims escaped.
On December 17 2019, residents protested in Machakos against Deputy President William Ruto over threats he allegedly issued to Machakos Governor Alfred Mutua. [size=no report]
On December 17 2019, two suspects held for the murder of a priest alleged that they had been tortured by police while in custody in Embu (Kirimari, Manyatta).

On December 17 2019, a mob stoned to death a police officer in Korogocho slum of Nairobi (Ruaraka, Nairobi) as police attempted to arrest a suspect. The mob was trying to rescue the suspect, who escaped. Residents of the area claim the police officer was shot and killed by a colleague during the arrest. [size=no report]
On December 17 2019, residents protested in Kitui against Deputy President William Ruto over threats he allegedly issued to Machakos Governor Alfred Mutua. [size=400]
On December 20 2019, men protested in Kapsabet (Emgwen, Nandi) after police had raided the venue for an upcoming celebration event and poured out traditional beer. [size=dozens]
On December 21 2019, inter-clan clashes took place in Narok County, leaving 3 people dead and 15 more injured.
On December 22 2019, Al Shabaab militants stormed a construction site in Hagarsu (Mandera) and destroyed eqippment that was being used to construct the Arabia-Mandera road.
Around December 23 2019, a suspected crime gang leader was killed in uncertain circumstances and his body dumbed in Maungu, Taita Taveta County.
On December 23 2019, an IED exploded near military forces patrolling in Lagh Kutulo, Wajir (Al Shabaab assumed responsible). No injuries were reported.
On December 23 2019, members of the Maasai community protested along the Mai Mahiu-Narok Highway near Mai Mahiu (Narok) after 32 sheep were killed by a speeding truck. [size=no report]
On December 24 2019, residents of Kapkwen (Bomet) protested after a pedestrian was killed by a motorist. [size=no report]

On December 25 2019, police officers in civilian clothes allegedly took two boys to a petrol station in Pangani (Starehe, Nairobi) and shot them. The police boss claims the incident was a shootout between police officers and criminals.
On December 25 2019, a man was allegedly beaten to death by a mob during a botched robbery in Kintengela (Kaputiei North, Kajiado). [size=no report]
On December 26 2019, Al Shabaab militants kidnapped two civilians who were traveling in the Liboi area (Dadaab, Garissa) and took them to Somalia. They were released on December 27.
Around December 26 2019, four police officers raided the home of a civilian. They shot and injured him after questioning him about illegal activities.
On December 27 2019, 2 Kenyan security forces were killed and 7 others injured when their vehicle ran over an IED on the Kutulo-Khorof Kharar road in Wajir (Al Shabaab assumed responsible).

column8: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) Prison Guards
column17: On December 27 2019, rioters attacked two prison warders who had arrested a person in Ruiru (Kiambu). [size=no report]
On December 28 2019, an assailant armed with a machete attacked 3 people along the Kibaoni-Mpeketoni road in Lamu county. 3 injuries and no fatalities were reported.
On December 29 2019, a police officer shot dead a driver who had refused to bribe him in Trans Mara district, Narok County. The police officer was arrested.
On December 29 2019, a mob attacked a man who had allegedly killed his father in Ikurungu village (coded as Kutu, Kirinyaga County). [size=no report]

On December 29 2019, angry residents destroyed property and looted a clinic run by an NGO in Kasipul, Homa Bay, due to a land dispute between the NGO and the Kitanda clan. 2 people were arrested. [size=no report]
On December 31 2019, a suspected Al Shabaab returnee was killed in Watamu, Dabaso, Kilifi. The victim's family has accused the police of killing him.
On December 31 2019, a man and his 12-year-old son were killed by unidentified assailans in Baragoi, Samburu.
On January 1 2020, parents protested at the Kwoyo Kodalo school near Rongo (Migori) to demand the dismissal of the principal due to poor test results. [size=no report]
On January 1 2020, women leaders and residents protested in Ndhiwa (Homa Bay) against the rape and killing of a 12-year-old girl. [size=no report]
On January 2 2020, residents of Kisumu stormed a hospital to demand the arrest of a police officer who had allegedly raped a 16-year-old girl. [size=no report]
On January 2 2020, Kenyan soldiers killed 4 suspected Al Shabaab fighters and arrested 1 other in Nyongoro (Lamu County) after the fighters had attacked a bus in the area.
On January 2 2020, residents of Kathiani (Machakos County) protested over the poor state of a road. [size=no report]
On January 2 2020, Al Shabaab attacked a bus in Lamu county, killing 3 people and injuring 2 others.
On January 2 2020, employees of the Guard Force Group protested outside their employer's office in Nyali to demand payment. [size=no report]
On January 3 2020, assailants destroyed houses in Thika (Kiambu) related to a land dispute.
On January 4 2020, youths supporting President Kenyatta disrupted the press briefing of Kandara MP Alice Wahome. [size=no report]

On January 5 2020, residents stormed the police station in Yamumbi near Eldoret (Kapsoya, Ainabkoi, Uasin Gushu) to demand the arrest of gang members they said had been terrorizing them. [size=no report]

column9: Military Forces of the United States (2017-)
column17: On January 5 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked Camp Simba military base in Manda Bay (Lamu) used by Kenyan and US military forces. Soldiers repelled the attack and killed 4 militants. 1 Kenyan soldier and 3 US soldiers were also killed, though Kenyan authorities denied the casualty.
On January 5 2020, angry residents blocked the road into Kawangware (Nairobi County) over the poor state of roads. [size=no report]
On 5 January 2020, suspected Al-Shabaab militants raided a village in Fino (Lafey, Mandera) and abducted five civilians, four were later released. No casualties reported.
On January 6 2020, angry parents prevented the head teacher from accessing Suna primary school in Migori County due to poor test scores. [size=no report]
On January 6 2020, a mob killed a suspected robber during an attempted robbery of a shop in Mwingi (Kitui). 2 other robbers escaped unharmed. [size=no report]
On January 6 2020, angry parents stormed the Kwenikab Ilet school in Ndarawetta (Bomet County) and ejected the principal due to poor exam results. [size=no report]
On January 6 2020, residents tried to kill a man who was suspected to have murdered a child in Makueni county. Police intervened to disperse the rioters. [size=no report]
On January 6 2020, an angry mob killed a teacher and burnt her body in Mutitu, Kitui County, over poor test scores. 2 people were arrested. [size=no report]

On January 7 2020, Al Shabaab militants fired at a Safaricom mast and clashed with police guarding the facility in Saretho in Dadaab, Garissa County. Children from a nearby school were also targeted in the attack. 4 civilians and 2 attackers were killed.
On January 8 2020, workers employed by Nairobi County protested outside city hall to demand payment. No further information was available. [size=no report]
On January 9 2020, traders protested along the railway in Chaka and Karatina in Nyeri County due to being displaced for the revival of the railway. [size=no report]

On January 10 2020, police used tear gas to disperse MPs who had gathered at the Kilimani police station in Nairobi County to demand the release of an MP that had been arrested following an assault claim against him. [size=scores]
On January 11 2020, Al Shabaab militants attacked a police post and then a communications post nearby in Olla, Mandera County. No casualties were reported.

On January 11 2020, a bishop was picked up by two men on a motorbike allegedly wearing police uniforms from his home in Alego, coded as Siaya in Siaya county. His family suspects he was kidnapped due to a land dispute case.

On January 12 2020, students from Egerton University rioted and clashed with police at the Njoro Campus in Nakuru County after the institution imposed fines on students for damage due to a riot on December 4. [size=no report]
On January 12 2020, teachers protested in Nairobi against negligence after a teacher was murdered and accused of being involved in crime. [size=no report]
On January 12 2020, a former KDF soldier was killed by an angry mob at a funeral in Siaya county after an argument broke out. 2 other people were injured. [size=no report]

On January 13 2020, students from Egerton University rioted and clashed with police at the Njoro Campus in Nakuru County after the institution imposed fines on students for damage due to a riot on December 4. [size=no report]

On January 13 2020, a man was beaten up by a mob after he was rescued by the police following a failed suicide attempt in Nairobi. He had attempted to hang himself from a traffic light post. [size=no report]
On January 13 2020, matatu drivers blocked the road with stones and burning tires in Kasarani, Nairobi county, over the poor state of roads. [size=no report]
On January 13 2020, suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked a school in Kamuthe, Garissa County, killing 3 male teachers and injuring 1 child. They also destroyed a Safaricom communication mast.
On January 14 2020, angry parents ejected the principal of Gamba Secondary School in Migori during a demonstraion over poor test results. [size=no report]
On January 14 2020, residents rioted for the second day in Kasarani over the poor state of the Mwiki-Kasarani road in Nairobi county. [size=no report]
On January 15 2020, food vendors protested in Kerugoya, Kirinyaga county over harassment by public health workers. [size=no report]

On January 16 2020, people demonstrated in Nairobi after a youth was killed during a disagreement with a police officer. [size=no report]
On January 16 2020, residents and workers protested in Kijabe, Nakuru County, over the Kijabe hospital's decision to fire 200 employees. [size=no report]
On January 16 2020, police dispersed residents as they rioted for the fourth day in Kasarani over the poor state of the Mwiki-Kasarani road in Nairobi county. [size=no report]

On January 17 2020, members of the Maasai community blocked the Mai Mahiu-Narok road near Suswa, accusing the government of failing to resettle them due to construction of the dry port in Mai Mahiu. [size=no report]
On January 17 2020, residents barricaded the Chebole-Chebango-Kipketii road over bad road conditions in Sotik, Bomet county. [size=no report]
On January 17 2020, a march took place in Nairobi to protest gender violence, taxation, and poverty levels. [size=no report]

column6: Police Forces of Kenya (2013-) General Service Unit
column7: Military Forces of Kenya (2013-); Pandanguo Communal Militia (Kenya)
column17: On January 18 2020, around 60 suspected Al Shabaab militants attacked Pandanguo in Lamu, engaging residents in a gunfight before clashing with Kenyan police and military forces. No fatalities were reported.
On January 18 2020, residents barricaded the Chebole-Chebango-Kipketii road for the second day in a row over bad road conditions in Sotik, Bomet county. [size=no report]

On January 19 2020, residents barricaded the Chebole-Chebango-Kipketii road for the third day in a row over bad road conditions in Sotik, Bomet county. [size=no report]
