Gaddafi forces heavily shell the southern outskirts of Zlitan, a city under fire for several days. Two houses hit, six injured.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US and UK forces fire 110 Tomahawk at various Libyan air defense sites. The missiles were fired from ships anchored in the Mediterranean. It is unclear if the strikes were successful.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column16: Al Arabiya; Pioneer (India); Africa Research Bulletin
column17: A three-story building in a military command centre used by Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi has been destroyed in an air strike by coalition forces. Supporters gather to form a human shield Gaddafi forces claim civilian death as a result, though no numbers are provided. An allied cruise missile strike also ""completely destroyed"" a Libyan Naval base 10km east of Tripoli known as Busetta.
A group of armed men raided a foreign ship in Tripoli harbor. It is believed they took the crew hostage.

A rebel aircraft was shot down by Gaddafi forces. Despite continued attacks on Benghazi from Gaddafi forces rebel forces also shot down two Gaddafi aircraft with artillery and slow their advance into the city.
Libyan military forces civilians living in Misratah to stand on their rooftops and act as ""human shields"" from Western bombings, believing they will not fire upon civilians.
A Libyan pilot defects while in the air and implements a kamikaze style attack on a Gaddafi stronghold, killing his sixth son, Khamis Gaddafi.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: 19 B-2 bombers complete a run of strategic locations early in the morning. Libyan state television report 64 civilians were killed and 150 wounded as a result of the blasts.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO launches a bombing run of strategic Tripoli locations. Buildings in Libya leaders residential area destroyed, but US and UK deny Gaddafi was target.
Forces loyal to Gaddafi fired on a crowed of unarmed rebel civilians and killed at least nine.
Gaddafi forces launch an overnight air raid on Tripolis rebel locations.
Rebel forces under ""intense attack"" in Misratah. Causality list not provided.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO forces launch an airstrike and destroys many Gaddafi tank positions in and around Benghazi. Bodies of fourteen government soldiers are later found.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Allied forces shell areas controlled by Gaddafi. No report of causalities or damage.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Allied forces shell areas controlled by Gaddafi. No report of causalities or damage.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Allied forces shell areas controlled by Gaddafi. No report of causalities or damage.
A town continues to be under siege by Libyan forces for a week.
Libyan forces shell Zlitan with heavy artillery, causing residents to flee and seek shelter in caves outside the city. Six killed.

Gaddafi forces shell Misratah with tank artillery. Four children reported dead. Rebel forces insist they are still in control of the city, though Libyan soldiers roam the streets and appear to have control of the city.
Gaddafi forces gain control of a Misratah port.
Ground fighting continues between Gaddafi and rebel forces.
Ground fighting continues between Gaddafi and rebel forces.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Canadian CF-18s bomb a Gaddafi supply depot in the Misratah region.
Gaddafi artillery bombs on a rebel town, forcing them to retreat from all but a 1/4 of the city. Sixteen reported killed.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A large blast reported at a Gaddafi held military base. No report of causalities or other information, though Gaddafi forces sent a communique blaming NATO and rebel forces and vowing revenge. According to Libyan state television NATO forces bombed civilian and military sites.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO forces launch a 1:30am airstrike over Gaddafi positions over Masratah. The intermittent explosions ended around 11am. No report of causalities.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column7: Military Forces of the United States (2009-2017)
column17: US forces bomb the wreckage of a recently downed F-15 so that its technology would not find enemy hands.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: The Danish government reports its military forces have dropped bombs over Libyan targets, though a specific location is not provided.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan state television reports allied forces bombed military and civilian targets in and around Tripoli. NATO later substantiated this stating they had launched 24 Tomahawk missiles.
Gaddafi snipers fire at a hospital treating the rebel wounded. Sixteen reported deaths.
Rebel forces report they have killed 30 Gaddafi snipers over several days of fighting.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: French fighter jets down a Libyan fighter jet violating the imposed no fly zone over Misratah.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO forces bomb Gaddafi locations in a Tripoli neighborhood at 1pm, Gaddafi forces respond with anti-aircraft fire. 6

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column7: Military Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-)
column17: British Tornado jets launch missiles on a Libyan armored transport leaning into Ajdabiya during the overnight hours. No causality list provided.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column7: Military Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-)
column17: British submarines launch strikes on Libyan air defenses.
Gaddafi forces shell the outskirts of Misratah, killing six people, including three children. Tanks later enter the city center.

column7: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Rebel forces, aided by NATO air support, are able to recapture Ajdabiya.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A Gaddafi military site is in flames following three loud explosions after a NATO raid.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan forces claim NATO forces have killed at least 100 civilians in recent Tripoli airstrikes.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A French air strike destroys least five Libyan Galeb warplanes and at least two MI-35 combat helicopters.
Two loud blasts were heard and a vast plume of smoke seen near Libyas eastern town of Ajdabiya, where rebels are fighting Gaddafi forces.

Government forces have kidnapped and beaten up residents of Zawiyah since recapturing the city two weeks ago. ""They [Gaddafis men] kidnap young men, old men, anyone below the age of 50 or 60, whether an engineer or a simple construction worker, and they are taken to an unknown location,"" according to a local.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO air raids outside Misratah.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO air strikes reported in Sirte. Causality numbers not provided.

column17: Three Gaddafi fighter killed during fighting, bringing the total of dead to 117 dead and 1,300 wounded after a week of fighting.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Early morning NATO air raid on Tripoli.

column17: NATO air strikes reported in Sabha. Causality numbers not provided.

column7: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Gaddafi forces begin a retreat in two towns following sustained bombing and fighting. This site is particularly valuable due ti its oil producing capability.

column17: Rebel forces take Ras Lanuf, Gaddafi forces retreat toward Sirte, a stronghold.
Following losses, Gaddafi forces resume motor and artillery attacks on Misratah. Four reported killed.

column17: Air raids hit Gaddafi targets in Sirte, however, loyalist troops slow advance of Rebels.

Woman is dragged away by government forces following rape claims.
Rebel forces take a small town in the south.
Rebels report Gaddafi forces using civilians as human shields in Misratah.
Rebel forces reach a small town en route to Sirte, take the town, but are held up by Gaddafi forces the following day.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: According to Libyan state television, NATO forces bomb civilian and military locations. No causality list.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: BBC television quoted a Libyan doctor as saying that a Western coalition air strike had killed seven civilians, mostly children, and wounded another 25 people near the oil town of Brega/
Gaddafi forces launch a fresh charge causing rebel fighters and civilians to flee recently captured towns. Causality list not reported.
Gaddafi forces launch a fresh charge causing rebel fighters and civilians to flee recently captured towns. Causality list not reported.
Frontline rebel fighter flee positions due to a Gaddafi assault.
Gaddafi forces launch a fresh charge causing rebel fighters and civilians to flee recently captured towns. Causality list not reported.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: The Canadian Defense Ministry reports it has dropped 240 smart bombs over Libya between the dates of 3/31/2011 - 5/25/2011.

Anti-government fighters are locked in a fierce battle with government troops for control of Libyas eastern oil town of Brega. The two sides clashed on the outskirts of the town on Friday a day after pro-democracy forces scrambled to flee amidst fighting with troops loyal to Gaddafi.
Change to armed group: A top Gaddafi aid defects to Britain.
Rebels hit loyalist positions. Casualties not reported.
Rebels hit loyalist positions. Casualties not reported.
Rebels hit loyalist positions, loyalist forces here call for ceasefire. Casualties not reported. Rebels refuse to let civilians and reporters leave the city during the clash.

Gaddafi snipers fire from the rooftops. Casualties not reported, though locals report ""blood in the streets."" It was not clear what triggered long bursts of machine gun and automatic gunfire that echoed around the city centre for about 20 minutes and stopped before dawn.
Rebels hit loyalist positions, loyalist forces here call for ceasefire. 25 reported killed. Rebels refuse to let civilians and reporters leave the city during the clash.
Heavy fighting in Misratahs western regions as Gaddafi forces move in. 25 reported killed, plus wounded.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO planes accidentally fire upon a rebel convoy, killing four civilians, nine rebels and wounding several others.

Chad on Sunday called on coalition forces to protect its citizens in rebel-held areas in Libya, saying dozens had been accused and executed for allegedly being mercenaries in the pay Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi.
Gaddafi forces fire rockets into a small town.
Gaddafi protesters clash with Gaddafi fighters along a coastal road between Brega and Ajdabiya. No information on causalities.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO forces mistakenly kill sixteen rebel fighters and wound others while they tried to hit a Gaddafi tank position. NATO leaders express regret.

column8: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Five anti-Gaddafi protesters are mistakenly killed in a NATO airstrike.
Rebel forces gain ground in Brega, casualties not reported.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Gaddafi forces publicly blames NATO for bombing an oil field, though NATO denies this. Three security guards reported killed.
Rebel fighter and civilians flee Ajdabiya when Gaddafi forces make gains.
Heavy fighting breaks out in Misratah with four civilians killed, as loyalist forces sought to dislodge rebels, insurgent sources.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Despite the instituted no-fly-zone, NATO jets intercept a Libyan MiG-23 and force it to land.
Despite the instituted no-fly-zone Libyan forces operate a Soviet Mil Mi-24 attack helicopter.
Rebel forces capture 15 Algerian mercenaries fighting for Gaddafi during a battle.
Kibyan forces make further gains toward the rebel held city of Ajdabiya. Five killed.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO airstrike destroys 14 Gaddafi tanks near Misratah.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO forces launch an air attack on Gaddafi positions, leaving civilian ""women, men and children dead"", according to Libyan state television. No numbers given.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO airstrikes on Tripoli. Civilians causalities reported.
People gather to protest, urging NATO to send more airstrikes against Gaddafi forces.

Masratah comes under heavy bombing by Gaddafi forces, who fired dozens of Grad missiles and tank shells which killed at least 23 people and injured 50. Reports the civilian population was targeted. Three Egyptians were also killed in the blitz.
Forces loyal to Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi killed seven rebel fighters and wounded 11 in attacks on the town of Yafran in western Libya.
Eight rebel fighters killed by Gaddafi cluster bombs.
Three civilians killed by Gaddafi cluster bombs.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO launched three new air strikes in and around Tripoli. They struck a missile battery and two other targets.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strikes hit a town.
Six rebels killed and 16 wounded when Gaddafi forces bomb a road east of Ajdabiya that leads into the city.

column17: Portions of a rural desert location are targets of NATO strikes.

Rebel forces push closer to Brega, and now are in control of a very small edge of the city.
100 civilians were wounded when government forces attacked an aid station in Misratah.
Gaddafi forces launch an attack on rebel forces on the southern outskirts of the city after outflanking rebels. One witness saw a dozen rockets fired.
Seventeen are killed in hand-to-hand combat between forces in Masraths city centre when government troops laid siege to the city. Rebel forces gain ground.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO forces bomb a small city, according to Libyan military forces.

column17: NATO bombs Tripoli and Sirte. Causalities not reported.

At least five civilians have been killed in a day of fierce clashes between pro-government troops and rebel forces in the western city of Misratah. Most of the fighting occurred on Nakl el-Thequeel Road as well as Tripoli Street.
Gaddafi and rebel forces fight for control of a border town/crossing.
Motor bombs kill three rebels overnight.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO bombing kills nine civilians, according to Libyan government sources.

Rebel forces overrun Gaddafi forces at a border town after the three day battle, causing government forces to flee across the border into Tunisia. Despite fleeing they Gaddafi forces reentered Libya the following day.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO launches airstrikes on Misratah.

column17: NATO launches several strikes on several northwest cities.

Retreating Gaddafi forces from Misratah set booby traps in their wake, causing 15 rebels to be killed when they overran the city. Many Gaddafi snipers remain on rooftops, fire at rebel forces.

column17: Libyan state television report the bombings of two small towns by NATO.

Rebel forces gain ground in Misratah, claim victory over city.
Large explosions in many districts of Tripoli due to fighting, one such explosion detonated destroyed Gaddafis office in his compound.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)

36 rebel fighters reported killed and 100 wounded in fighting since the previous day.

Rebels gain control of a small western town.
Eight Gaddafi soldiers are dead when violence breaks out at a rebel controlled border post. Rebels fired on government forces from nearby mountains.
Rebel forces overrun Misratah airport, seizing control from Gaddafi forces.

Gaddafi forces shell a residential neighborhood, kill 10.
Heavy fighting has erupted on two fronts on the outskirts of the city of Misrata, with government troops using tanks to try to keep rebel forces at bay.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO bombing run on Tripoli. The strikes have damaged offices of parliamentary staff and a building officials said housed a commission for children and women.

Pro-Gaddafi protesters torch the vacant British and Italian diplomatic embassy after Libya accused NATO of trying to assassinate Gaddafi in an attack that killed one of his sons and three young grandchildren.
Forces loyal to Muammar Gaddafi are fighting a gun battle with rebels around the Libyan town of Wazin on the Libyan-Tunisian border. No report of causalities.
A car bomb exploded not far from a headquarters of Libyas rebels in their eastern bastion of Benghazi on Tuesday night, slightly injuring two people, officials said.
Gaddafi forces shell rebel held Misratah port, killing five.
Indiscriminate attacks by Gaddafi forces in the besieged city of Misrata, including the use of snipers, cluster bombs and artillery in civilian areas.

column17: NATO forces hit several Gaddafi held cites.

column17: NATO forces hit several Gaddafi held cites.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strike on Libyan positions. State television reports 16 civilians were killed and 40 were wounded.

column17: NATO aircraft have blasted an oil terminal in a key eastern city in a nightfall strike, Libyan state television reports.

column17: NATO forces strike eight Libyan ships in three cities ports. They were all naval warships with no civilian utility.

column17: NATO forces strike eight Libyan ships in three cities ports. They were all naval warships with no civilian utility.
Armed Libyans angry over a gasoline shortage stormed onto a bus carrying a group of foreign journalists and attempted to attack them before a soldier fired a weapon into the air to disperse them.
A Gaddafi forces attack on a Libya/Tunisia border crossing results in nine deaths, mostly of Gaddafi loyalists.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: An early morning NATO airstrike on the Bab al-Aziziya neighborhood kills 19 and wounds more than 150. It is unclear if the causalities were civilian or military.

column17: Libyan state television reports a NATO airstrike hit a school.

column17: Several large explosions rocked the Libyan capital Tripoli on Thursday night and a column of smoke was seen rising from Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafis Bab al-Aziziyah compound.
Reports of forced migration among a local tribal region at the hands of Gaddafi forces.

Rebels and loyalist forces engaged in fierce fighting on the Western outskirts of the city of Misrata. reporter said he could see white puffs of smoke and dust from where mortars fired by pro-Gaddafi forces were landing. Six rebel fighters wounded, two critically.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan state television reports the Al Qaryat districts of the city was bombed bt NATO forces late into the evening.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: State sources report a NATO bombing hit a school.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: For the fourth successive night, powerful blasts rocked Bab Al-Aziziya near the city centre, an AFP correspondent said as Libyan state media reported air raids on the Al-Qariet region south of the capital. No word on causalities.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)

column17: RAF Typhoons raid Gaddafis compound, destroying several connected guard towers.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO strike on a town kills 11, according to state television.

Hundreds of residents of the impoverished neighborhood of Bab al-Tabbaneh staged a demonstration over the weekend to demand the release of Syrian refugees who are reportedly being held by the Lebanese Army.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A Libyan government spokesman says NATO bombing campaigns have killed 718 civilians since the beginning of their operations.
Fighting breaks out at a Gaddafi stronghold. Nine NLA forces were killed as prisoners of war, and government forces refused to give the bodies of the dead rebels back to their families.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column7: Military Forces of the United Kingdom (2010-)
column17: RAF Typhoon and Tornado jets struck ten Gaddafi-regime ammunition storage bunkers and a military vehicle at a site near Waddan in Libya, using enhanced Paveway II and Paveway IV bombs.

A car bomb exploded in the parking lot of a hotel hosting most foreign diplomats including the American envoy, security advisers, U.N. officials and some Western media outlets. It caused no casualties but immediately prompted the rebel leadership to blame Gaddafi forces for the attack, though this cannot be substantiated.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO strike hits a Gaddafi radar installation site within the capital.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Gaddafi forces fired several rockets at a Canadian warship earlier in the week, but failed to score a hit.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A French military source said French planes and helicopters had been operating in Libya every night since through Monday, but declined to give further details.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: At least six powerful explosions were heard from central Tripoli early in the evening from NATO bombing.

column17: British Apache helicopters destroyed a radar station and a military checkpoint held by Gaddafi forces near Brega.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO forces score a hit on a Gaddafi controlled command center.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO forces score hits on the following: Two command and control facilities, one surface-to-air missile storage facility, one ground forces compound, one air defense forces compound, four surface-to-air missile launchers and one radar near Tripoli.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO strike hits three Gaddafi military vehicles near Brega.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO airstrike hits a Gaddafi armored vehicle near Misratah.

Gaddafi forces shell an NLA controlled town.
Libyan rebels seized all of the mountain town of Yafran from Gaddafi forces.
Clashes broke out between Gaddafi and NLA forces 18km outside of Ajdabiya.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO blasts hit central Tripoli early in the morning. No report of causalities.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: At least 29 killed in 60 airstrikes on Tripoli throughout the course of the day, Libyan state media reports.
Rebel forces have reportedly captured or kidnapped civilians arbitrarily and detained them indefinitely. One killed due to torture. Specific dates not provided.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strike hits near a Gaddafis residence in Tripoli early in the morning.
Gaddafi forces shell the rebel city of Misratah, killing 10 fighters.
Heavy fighting in a small town, 22 rebel fighters reported killed over two days of fighting.
The people of a small town came under attack by government forces after they held an anti-government protest. ""Dozens"" killed.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Three separate NATO airstrikes on Tripoli positions.

At least 31 killed and 110 wounded during a battle on the outskirts of Misratah.
Movement of forces: Gaddafi forces surround the rebel city of Zlitan.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Canadian CF-18 bomb strategic locations of Gaddafi positions in Tripoli.

Fighting kills 13 rebel fighters, plus civilians in a small oil town outside Tripoli. The battle began when rebels began an offensive toward Tripoli. Rebel forces are defeated after several hours of fighting.
Five killed and 21 injured when Gaddafi forces shell Zlitan after surrounding it the previous day.
Six rebels killed in fighting outside of Misratah, most from mortar blasts.
Gaddafi forces bomb Misratah. No report of causalities.
21 NLA fighters killed and many wounded during a clash along the coastal road between Brega and Ajdabiya.
Nine killed during a Gaddafi bombardment of rockets and artillery on a rebel city.
Members of a local tribe (name not given) protest Gaddafi.
Rebels and Gaddafi forces battle for the second consecutive day over an oil town near Tripoli.
Forces loyal to Gaddafi flee a town when they are over run by NLA forces.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO strike ahead of a NLA advance hits a bus and kills 12 passengers.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO airstrike hits Tripoli. Plumes of smoke and a fire lit up the sky, the correspondent said after a quiet day in the Libyan capital.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO bombing hit civilian and military targets, according to state media sources. It said the bombing targeted the al-Rawagha district of the town.

A mass grave with up to 15 bodies has been discovered outside Ajdabiya. The grave, 18 kilometres to the south of the town, contained at least one corpse wearing a uniform. Ajdabiya CID has begun an investigation and is seeking to identify the dead. There has been speculation that the grave dates from the Revolution.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)

column17: An RAF Tornado launched a smart bomb, which destroys a Gaddafi Tank. It is unknown if the tank was inhabited by a soldier.
Gun battles between forces loyal to Gaddafi and rebels in Libyas northwestern city of Nalut killed at least 8 rebels and wounded 13 more.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO carries out an early morning airstrike on the Suq al-Jumuah district of the city. Libyan state television reported that many buildings were destroyed and fifteen, including two toddlers were killed in the explosions.
Four rebel fighters were reported killed when Gaddafi forces shelled their positions west of the city.
Non-violent activity: Rebel forces shut off a pipeline in southern Libya that supplies Tripoli.
Gaddafi forces fire four rockets into Misratahs city centre. It was not immediately clear if anyone was killed or wounded in the attack.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO launched a military strike on Brega. Gaddafi forces claim civilian targets were hit, killing 15, however NATO rejects this insisting the targets were military sites.

Libyan rebels south of Tripoli have advanced to within about 80 km of the capital and are fighting government troops for control of the town of Bir al-Ghanam. The fighting lasts more than 24 hours. Causalities reported, but not in specific numbers.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO begins a series of bombing runs over the course of two days on a small town south of Tripoli. Libyan state television reports there were civilians causalities and many buildings, including a school, destroyed in the blasts.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan television reports NATO bombings on three towns which destroyed ""livestock, crops, infrastructure, civilian and military locations."" No causality numbers provided.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan television reports NATO bombings on three towns which destroyed ""livestock, crops, infrastructure, civilian and military locations."" No causality numbers provided.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan television reports NATO bombings on three towns which destroyed ""livestock, crops, infrastructure, civilian and military locations."" No causality numbers provided.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strikes at enemy positions hitting one ammunition storage facility.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strikes at enemy positions hitting one military technical vehicle.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strikes at enemy positions hitting one battle tank, one military technical vehicle.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strikes at enemy positions hitting one multiple rocket launcher, five battle tanks, two artillery pieces, three military vehicles.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strikes at enemy positions hitting one self-propelled anti-aircraft gun, one military technical vehicle, two multiple rocket launchers and one military equipment storage facility.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strikes at enemy positions hitting four battle tanks, one military technical vehicle, one heavy equipment transport.

column6: Military Forces of Libya (1969-2011) Special Forces
column17: Libyan television reported Libyan Special Forces killed two members of Al-Qaeda and claimed they were conspiring with NATO to destroy the stability of Libya.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: NATO strikes at enemy positions hitting twelve military vehicles, one military truck, one armored personnel carrier, one ammunition storage, one military compound and one military checkpoint.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan television reports a NATO bombing somewhere in the Al Jufrah district.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: A NATO raid causes three large explosions in central Tripoli. Columns of black smoke were seen rising from the direction of Gaddafis central Bab Al Aziziya compound.
NLA forces withdraw from a town 80km south of Tripoli after they come under heavy bombardment from Gaddafi forces.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: The Daily Telegraph reports that Sudanese military forces have seized the southern town of Kufra. They apparently encountered no resistance from the Gaddafi regime.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan state television reports NATO strikes on civilian checkpoints. Causalities reported.
A car bomb, undetonated, is discovered outside a Benghazi hotel. . Sources claimed the car was parked there for weeks before the discovery

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: Libyan state television reports NATO strikes on civilian checkpoints. Causalities reported.
Shelling by Gaddafi forces kills 11 and wounded another 57 in Misratah. The causalities were almost all civilians.

column6: Operation Unified Protector: NATO Mission in Libya (2011-2011)
column17: State television reports NATO forces bombed locations in the Al Jufrah District.
